text: Sonny: What the hell is this? Clemenza: It's a Sicilian message. It means Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes.  The Codfather does not sleep with the fishes, but rather eats them, as my bumpersticker proudly boasts. Chippy + Corner Shoppe. Jelly Babies and Full English. Ta. We were driving around Phoenix and confronted by a billboard that boasted the best cod and chips this side of East End. One does not expect that in Phoenix, but the Codfather does not disappoint. This is the stuff. Up the Codfather!
Real, and I mean real English fish & chips that are fabulous. Nice casual environment. Next time I have to try the Shepard's pie.

Outstanding! Ignore anything less than 5 stars reviews!   I'm British and this place is authentic, the owners have done a great job recreating an English Pub/Chippie What more do you people expect, we're in the AZ!

Used Resturant.com to try this place and it is the reason I stopped by. Had a $10 coupon, had to get regular items to total before we could use it on the special or alcohol, not a big deal as I understand they need to make money to stay in business. (unlike other people whining here)  It's in a strip mall, but inside its a nice place, love the ambiance. The food was outstanding. Garlic Onion Rings, melt in your mouth good. Also had the Calamari and Cod and Sea Bass. Enough food for a lunch repeat the next day. Yes, the food would kill you if you did it everyday, but for a treat it is great.  The authentic foods were cool. I'll probably be back the next time I get a craving. The Onion Rings were that good.

I can not believe I had never been here. I lived in England and miss the food from there. This place is authentic. They even have Haddock. We had calamari, Haddock, "chips", and chicken fingers. All was good and very crispy just like in the UK. They even have a mini grocery store with all your favorites. The service was great. Judy was very happy and helpful. The hostess was also great. Great for kids, there is a Lego table in the dinning side for them with three stations.

I will start by saying I have never been to the UK but I have had my fair share of Fish & Chips at several places.  Service was great, tried a couple beers and decided on the Speckled Hen on Nitro. Delicious brew(for a non-stout!) Went for a basic Fish & Chips(small) and a Beef & Kidney Pie!  Took a little time to come out which is fine because I know it was made to order. Fish was simple, but not over-breaded or over-fried. Chips were great! Little crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The Beef & Kidney pie was yummy!!! Perfectly flaky crust and great flavor. BE CAREFUL!!!! This thing is hot!!!!! Cut it in 1/2 and leave it alone for at least 5-7min they bring it to you right out of the oven!  They have a very nice looking menu with several seafood and meat and even curry options. Super local to me, a place I will definitely go back to! Friday/Saturday all you can eat Fish and Chips for $12.95 and Happy Hour  from 3p-6p with a nice discount on beers!

I love the selection of the fishes. The mashed potato & cabbage side dish are also amazing.  However, we didn't get our appetizer till after we finish our dinner and our complimentary chips were stale, greasy, and soft. Very disappointing.  Not sure if I would go out of my way to give it another try, but might if I am around the area.

Been wanting to try this place for a long time.  I love fish and chips.  Finally did and my personal experience was not good.  I ordered the fish and chips and all I could taste was scorched oil.  The chips were very soggy.  The staff seemed nice so I may try it again because it seems like more people like it than not and this could have been an isolated case. But not anytime soon.

Not a huge fan of traditional British food, but I absolutely love good fish and chips - and this place makes great fish and chips!!  The rest, can't really say. Again, the cod fish and chips are to die for!  Having said that, there's one odd thing: you get a typical paper cup of tartar sauce with the meal, but if you want more they charge extra!?!?  Strange deal - hence 4-stars.

I thought there was too much oil left on the fish.  I joking tell friends it's like getting a quart of oil with your dinner.  I've tried them a few times now and I just can't deal with all the oil.  I even talked to the manager.  I asked if the oil wasn't hot enough or what...  I didn't get a satisfactory answer.  I give up on this place.  Try Oscar's Pier 83 instead; it's worth the drive.

Really wanted to like this place but unfortunately am writing this review from the comfort of my bathroom where I'm currently experiencing some gastrointestinal distress, sadly. Always a bad sign when you take your first bite and it tastes of old oil; then when the fish falls out of the fried batter casing also not a good sign. Had a sausage roll as well, seemed better off, had considerable sage flavor, and was a bit hot, spice-wise. Generally can't recommend.

This place was great! Our host was super nice and the restaurant was very clean. It's not very big, but the food was great. We ordered the Scotch egg to start, delicious. The cod and chips was great. We will definitely come back and recommend The Codfather.
Food is consistently great and they have a great selection of draught beers as well as a full bar. The desserts are wonderful. Full English breakfast served too. One of our favorites!

Yuck!!!!    Two of us tried the fish and chips at lunch and we hated it.  The first taste was off-putting.  The breading was crispy and light, but the taste was like the oil was old or the type of oil was wrong.  The fish under the batter was small and it was tasteless and mushy.  The chips, or french fries were OK, but needed some spices.  The ice tea was very good fresh brewed.  Maybe some of the other types of fish are better.  But if what we had is as good as it gets skip this place.  Long John Silvers is better, and I don't recommend them.  My dogs did like the leftovers, but they aren't very discriminating.

If ya want the true taste of English Fish and Chips, this is the only place to go in Arizona. The staff are very friendly and eager to please.  There is surprising amount of different beers on tap, and a broad range of bottom to top shelf spirits to choose from. The specials and off-menu fare change regularly as well. There is a import grocery section; if you want good Cadbury chocolate, there is plenty to choose from here. The prices are low, but the quality is high! The creator and owner, along with family, still work there and put a lot of pride into the food and service.

I have been looking for good english fish and chips in Phoenix.   This is my new favorite!   The fish tasted extremely fresh and actually like English style fish and chips unlike so many other pubs around the valley.    Great english beer selection!

I have driven by the place for years,I thought I would give it a shot. I really wish I would of kept driving. I ordered 77.00 worth of take out including 3 entrees and 2Apps and did not enjoy any of it. Everything was in the same batter and all tasted the same.. I will keep driving by.

Top notch fish & chips..... I love businesses where the owners are actually working on a regular basis. Owners usually seem to take more pride in their work, than hired help. Thats the case here as they provide Great customer service. Did I mention the fish & chips?

Fish had no flavor, Chips were soggy and tasted strange.  Took my order to the counter and said that is was terrible.  The young woman replied, "we don't give refunds".  She didn't offer something else or ask what was wrong.  Never going back.

Love this place.  It was a weekly spot for me.  Weekends they serve an English Breakfast. $9 flat rate.They offer the meal as a whole or you can a la carte it and buy elements of it.  The breakfast was tasty, always hot. I enjoyed with a pot of hot tea with milk.   As for their namesake, the fish and chips are good. The timing is a bit slow. But it's always hand battered and fried to order. The chips are not typical american thin and crispy, they are thick, a bit soggy, but delicious.  All sauces are on available upon request.  They just recently acquired their liquor license and now you can enjoy a Guiness or New Castle with lunch.   Great place for a quick bite.

I made the long haul out from east Mesa specifically for the market. Market is a really strong word for the little corner of product they had. They did have a few interesting things that I had been looking forward to trying. Unfortunately, a lot - and I mean a lot - of the items were out of date! The Heinz Salad Cream had an expiry of January 26, and my visit was on February 23! So...nope. There were a few flavors of Walker's crisps, but they were also all expired. Not by as much as the salad cream, so I did buy two packets thinking at least stale crisps won't give me food poisoning. I'll just stick to Internet ordering, I suppose. With so many of the "market" food items out of date, there is just no way I would ever try the restaurant side. I'm sad that it was so disappointing.

By far the best F&C's in the Phoenix Metro Area! I"m a Brit myself living in AZ and the food is spot on. WARNING: IF you're looking for American style "fries" and fish...this is not the place for you. IF you want traditionally British (grease and all) with real mushy peas, real chips cut from real potatoes (not frozen), homemade dessert, pastie etc or a proper English Breakfast  then I highly recommend you check this place out. Even the fryers are imported from the UK. I will definitely be back! ~Thank you & well done!!
Definitely a local place. Service is attentive but not super friendly. Food is not good The mushrooms for the appetizers are good tho.

I have driven by this place 50 times and I finally stopped in. When I got there it was quiet and only a few customers. I was by myself so i sat at the bar. I did wait 2-3 minutes for the guy to come over because he was talking to 2 other people at the bar. He was not over friendly and not very enthusiastic about serving me.  I have to say I am from new England so I know what good fish and chips look like and taste like. So I ordered the fish and chips.  After waiting what seemed to be an unusually long time my fish and chips was brought to me. it looked good.  But it was not what I expected. it was a little small for the price I paid. The fish was just not as good as it should have been. The fries were average. And it should have been a lot hotter. I was hungry so I did not send it back. He did not come over to ask how everything was till I was more than half done. And I expressed what I am saying here and he did not offer to get me more, replace the order, give me a discount, offer me anything off my next visit and it seemed like ok..........  Well needless to say I would not recommend this place to anyone nor will I go back.  They need to work on the personality of the guy behind the bar, presentation of the food and some personality to the place.
Grew up with a British mother, and I love all the things that they offer!  If I am craving something from my childhood, that is the place to go for me!

SO close, but just not quite there.  I don't know what it is, but there's an odd back-taste (more noticeable on the chips than the fish) - it just tastes like it's off.  Which it may be, because plenty of stuff in the store seems to be past it's sell-by date.  A real shame, because I think these guys actually know what they're doing - the fish and chips are prepared just right, but spoiled by the odd flavor (which, again, I'm putting down to old oil).  Except the scotch egg - it's AWFUL!  Having been an early customer and semi-frequent visitor, I think my visits have come to an end.  When I SEE so much out of date product and something tastes like it may be off, along with fairly heavy prices, I start to feel like I'm being fleeced by some dodgy geezer.  It's interesting to note that following their two Maricopa County inspections this year, the chose not to request a grade.  I could see 1, if there was an issue they needed to clear up, but back-back?  Just makes me a little suspicious.

First time there and was disappointed in the slow service & fish I ordered. Every fish item on the menu is fried. I asked for the cod fish to be baked. It ended up tasteless & dried out. Waited and waited for the scallop appetizer I ordered but it came out with the dinner. Although the brews & sides were good, I wasn't too impressed with the service or the fish.

I decided to give this place a try. We had a coupon so why not? I ordered the fried cod and chips and my husband ordered the mahi mahi. We a few shrimp and some onion rings as well. The decor is simple. The place felt a bit warm inside, but it was clean. They have an all u can eat fish fry on fridays.  I just got the large cod and chips plate. It came with 2 meaty, crispy pieces of fish and I did not care for the chips.  But then, I am not a french fry gal anyway. The fish was not greasy and perfectly battered. The tartar sauce is ok. a bit on the sweet side. My husband really enjoyed his mahi mahi with cocktail sauce. I thought the cocktail needed more of a kick, but it was fine.  I LOVE the garlic onion rings. It is a must if you go. Every table had a order of them so i figured they must be good and ordered them. I am glad we did! The dipping sauce is tasty too! If your in the area for some decent grub. Stop in. The service is friendly and the gal at the counter was helpful if you had any questions. They also serve curry,pasties,sweets and much more.

Came here for dinner with my family really bad service had to wait forever & the place was completely empty other then the bartender . I was expecting some delicious food! But was disappointed with it all. Especially for the prices it tasted so bland as well as the bread pudding was really bad .

Out of curiosity I tried this place yesterday for dinner.  What a mistake.  Worst fish and chips EVER!  Chips were underdone and oily.  The fish was greasy.  I've had better fish and chips at Red Robin.

I have been to this place twice in the last year. (I wanted to give it a fair chance so went twice.) On both occasions I could hardly cut through the cod. I have never seen cod like this - I am not sure where they get the fish or how long they have had it in their freezer but I was amazed. I am British  and have been eating fish and chips most  of my life in the UK so I am pretty sure I know what cod should taste like.  The chips were pretty dismal too, and I am not sure what they add to the mushy peas. Hope this helps you decide.

First and foremost they serve neither Coke nor Pepsi products from the fountain. Only RC Cola.   Turning to dinner. Being the first time here I naturally opted for the Fish and Chips ... this is supposed to be English cuisine after all. I chose the large Haddock a very lightly breaded piece of fish.  A Iittle greasy, ok a lot greasy, but very flavorful. The chips needed at least 3 more minutes in the fryer...no color and whimpy.   I gave it three stars as the fish was good, 2-1/2 stars likely more appropriate. I don't expect I'll be back.  I'll look for another fish and chips place next time.

We discovered The Codfather several years ago and have been going 3 or 4 times over the winter months every year since.  It's about 25 minutes from our house in North West Glendale but for us it's worth the trip!  The food is always great as is the service.  We always go on a Friday night and make sure we go early as they do get busy.  I also love the little British goods shop and usually pick up a treat or two after dinner.
You've been warned.   fried food is soaked in grease and recipe for heart attack.  I am sick and couldn't finish meal.  A waste of money

Cool place I'm not English but I do like the fish and chips. I agree with some of the other reviewers the frys are just stock off the truck frys nothing special. I would recommended it for lunch, you can get in and out pretty quick and its a good change of pace from the normal burger joint

I enjoy good fish and chips once in a while, so was looking forward to it.  As several others have noted, the batter was bland, too thick, too oily and didn't stay on the fish.  My husband enjoyed the Shepherd's pie.  I would give it another try, but not impressed.

This place has delicious fish and chips. I've only gotten the halibut so far. After the first time I went, I thought about going back all week! I'm new to Phoenix and so far this is my favorite place to eat.

Had British fish and chips before and this place was nowhere close to it. Had three orders of the cod and chips to go, got home and noticed how greasy the fish was and the frys tasted like it was frozen, not fresh cut. Petes fish and chips tasted closer to British than this place, only reason I gave it one star, the staff was nice and checked on us even though we were waiting for take outs. Not going back price to high for poor food.
My Father lived in England before I was born and he said he loves the Fish and Chips here they are very authentic. So I had to try it out. WOW! He was right. They were delicious!

My wife was in a mood for fish & chips, and with the closing of Chuy's (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k-_LMicC814) we haven't had a good place for a fish fry.  I searched for Fish & Chips on Yelp and found The Codfather.  I went to England on business last year and I was struck by how British restaurant this place looks.  It was clean but well-worn in a kind of homey way.  Looking past the decor, I noticed the wide-ranging collection of ales and stouts from all over the UK. I asked what beers were on tap and the girl started with Boddington's.  She didn't get any further.  If you haven't tried one, do it.    I went in planning on fish and chips, but then I saw bangers and mash (sausage and mashed potatoes with onion gravy) on the menu.  Wife ordered the cod and chips.  When our orders arrived, wife found the cod flaky and well battered, but a bit greasy.  The bangers and mash were flavorful, but heavy on the salt.  I'd have liked the potatoes better if they had lumps -- I suspect they were instant.  We'll probably go back, sometime but Wife is still missing her favorite fish at Chuy's.

We were visiting relatives in Phoenix, drove by the Long John Silver because we heard of this place run by an Englishman.  I really wanted genuine English Fish & Chips.  The shop is owned and run by Mark, his wife Ruth and Jordan, their son.  Straight from England to Phoenix and what a  treat!  The food is terrific!  Everything!.  Not only Fish & Chips but the whole range of traditional English Pub fare.   I had been in England several times but never ate Fish & Chips there.  Now I don`t have to, we have them here in Phoenix!  Great taste, friendly people, Mark even has a bar next to the shop, like a real English pub!   We were able to speak with Mark while we ate.  Very friendly and has a neat life story to tell.  He also told me about his fish.  What an education!  He uses only wild caught cod, halibut, which was caught in a sustainable manner and has no water, fillers or preservatives added.  The taste?  Fantastic.  If you have been longing for REAL English Fish & Chips, you will be glad you dined at the Codfather.

True English chip shop!  My family is from England and this is one of two places in Arizona that truly hit home for my family and I! We moved here over 20 years ago and it is seriously  good home cooked food!   I don't get to go very often as it is far from me but we get together as often as we can to treat ourselves to an English dinner! The fish and the sausages are just like home the pasties are just like home......okay everything is just like home. The only difference is that they don't serve it in newspaper!   If your looking for something different and can't travel to England this is a must! They even sell some of the goods we can't get anywhere else!

I visited this place in March 2015. I ordered the Fish and Chips...Normal setting ..nothing Fancy about this place. I worry about the Hygiene of the Staff ..I saw one staff member cough and didnt wash her hands...As for the food, the chips was badly fried..or it looks like they proceeded to give me the bottom of the pot chips..However, I did complain and the server went and brought fresh Chips for me...

Just left the restaurant at 8:40 after being told we could not order food to eat in. When we first walked in at 8:35 we were told to have a seat by the waitress and she would bring us menus. A short time later she came back and said she was just told we could order to go bit we couldn't eat in. WTF!!! You don't close till 9:00p and you tell customers that!! To top it off, we drive almost an hour to eat there as we heard good things about the place. Never be back again!!! What a joke!!!
Enjoyed the fish and chips very much. Fries needed seasoned but the fish was great. Also the crab cake was best we have ever had. Super moist! Server was very nice.
Great place near my house. I love the cheesecakes and the fish tacos are good too. I usually sit at the bar area but it also has a dining section.

This place is awesome! The cod fish and chips is delicious. The same goes for the Mahi. The large is definitely the way to go. The service was a little on the slow side, but the friendly service and food more than made up for it. They've earned a new customer.

I have been coming to this family run business since they first opened their doors in Fountain Hills - that was certainly a trek from my house in Buckeye! But it was worth it for some of the taste of home. Luckily, they moved to Bell Road, and I moved to Scottsdale, so I am much happier.... but not really. The restaurant is split into the food side and the bar side. I think the owner would rather concentrate on the bar business, because I never see him on the restaurant side - and that is a shame, because the consistency of the food being delivered is pretty awful. On some days I feel like I am on the Brighton seafront, eating fish and chips just like home... on other days the food is terrible, and I would rather eat that bag'o'shite they sell at Pete's Fish'n'Chips. The Codfather needs to keep an eye on quality control - it is not acceptable to serve chips that are fried in oil that is so old that everything tastes bitter. Likewise, cod should be a flaky, white fish - on my last visit with my family 3 of the 4 cod fillets had a grey streak through the fillet that none of us could cut through. This is as close to comfort food as us Brits are going to find in the Phoenix area. However, if this was my local 'chippie' back home, I wouldn't be happy to give them my custom. With every visit I leave more and more disappointed. On a positive note, some of the other menu items are very good - the bangers and mash always catches my eye, as does the steak and kidney pie. But, if you are going to call yourself a fish and chip restaurant, then you really should get the basics right.... and this restaurant fails in this regard.

Off the bat, I want to say that my review has absolutely nothing to do with the food I ordered. The fish and chips were phenomenal and honestly, the best I've had outside of London.   Unfortunately, I don't think I will return due to the poor service we received on Sunday.   We met another couple at the restaurant who had already been seated and the waitress took our drink orders. I had been craving a bloody mary and saw that they were on happy hour. After the order was placed it was about 7-10 minutes before my boyfriend's beer arrived even though there were only about 4 or 5 other tables occupied.   I glanced up at the waitress wondering where my drink was and she explained to me that while they had all of the things they needed to make a bloody mary, they were out of well vodka. And she could have them make me a bloody mary if I still wanted it, but I would not be receiving happy hour price.   I indicated that I would still like my drink (I didn't even receive the water that I ordered) but after she walked away, I couldn't figure out why I was being charged for the restaurants poor planning - if you run out of well vodka and still have 30 minutes left in your happy hour, you should serve the next vodka you have in stock and plan better next time.   My drink was prepared and sat at the bar until the waitress came to take our order. I hadn't seen the drink sitting there until I looked at the waitress like, "Am I going to get my drink?" and she found it. One of the guys at our table told me it had just been sitting there. At this point we had been at the restaurant for over 20 minutes and I still hadn't gotten the water I ordered.   Food took a long time to come out and while we were waiting, a guy from the back of the restaurant stood to roll silverware at the bar. He kept laughing at the stories we were telling at the table and made VERY strange and uncomfortable eye contact with me and the other female at the table every time we glanced up at the television above him. Eventually we made a point to glance elsewhere.   By the end of our meal, our waitress was eating her dinner next to our table behind the bar and dropping food down the front of her.   That being said, the food was incredible. Fish and chips cooked to perfection and the tartar sauce was quite good as well. This would absolutely be my go-to restaurant for fish and chips if the whole experience wasn't so strangely off-putting.
This place is great for the Friday Fish Fry. They also have an all you can eat special on Fridays. I also love their Margaretta's. They are made from scratch.

This is probably the best fish and chips this side of the Atlantic. It's a treat whenever I can make it out to this side of town! I just this place was closer to me. The food tastes fresh, the fish is lightly breaded and the fries are a little soggy. But that's the way the made it when I was in England in 2009. That may be where some people may have a difference of opinion as far as preference for their fries. If you're from across the pond and want a taste and atmosphere that reminds you of home, this is the place to be. Only thing different is the music. I can't wait to go back to England to explore more of such a wonderful country and people. Cheers!

My parents were born and raised in England and as a surprise I took them to Codfather while they were out visiting.  My Mother can be hard to please but she really enjoyed the food.  My kids and I love the fish and chips while my husband really enjoyed the steak and kidney pie. Don't go in here expecting American food.  You probably won't find the soda you like and they don't have a typical American kids menu but the food is excellent and well worth a try.

I love this place! It's a great family owned business with friendly owners. The food is always amazing and desserts are delicious. The service really shows that the staff cares and we enjoy seeing Mark and Ruth when we stop in. My husband and I started coming here for happy hour years ago and now come in with our son for family meals and every experience has us wanting more. I enjoy seeing a family owned business in my neighborhood and will continue to spread the word!

All right,  Get off your shagging, high horse, forget your  fast food, expect some (much needed abuse from Mark And Ruth (the owners) and stuff your face with the best fish and chips in the valley (coming from a "Brit" take it as Gospel) Poker night, a bar, bands, a British shop with all the yummy, very bad for you chocolate, crisps, sausage, meat pies, and all the other things that are sooooooo bad for us but oh, my god, taste...sooooooo good. Go here, forget your 60's and just enjoy the family run business that never fails to deliver.

The fish and chips were decent, but my husband's shepherd's pie was literally a frozen TV dinner that they'd microwaved - in a black plastic dish and everything.   (Also, the vinegar was definitely watered down. I could barely taste it even after saturating the fish.)

I really wanted to like this place, but it just didn't live up to the expectations I had. My friends had visited Codfather many times and often craved their fish and chips. I finally decided to tag along as I love seafood and they made it seem so intriguing. For my meal, I went with their recommendation and ordered the fish and chips. The breading on my fish was soggy and greasy, so the texture was unappetizing. The fish itself, while it seemed was decent quality, didn't have much flavor and the chips were also bland. My friends still seemed to think it was okay, but I've had plenty of good fish in my day and this, in my opinion, wasn't it. The price is a little high for the amount and quality of food you get, so I have yet to return and I'm not sure I will.
Awesome fish n chips and it stood up to some places we ate at in San Diego.  If you want some greasy fish and chips look no further!
Still awful food, feel bad that people would actually consider this to be typical British food. Go to Rosie's on Camelback, much better .
Great service great food!   Brought me back to the old school with the RC fountain drink.

I was so excited to try the Cod Father as I love Fish and Chips, Pies Sausage rolls etc.  It was some of the worst food I have had in a long time , the fish was chewy and hard , the batter was soggy and flavorless.  Even the Malt vinigar was watered down and had no taste.  My husbands meat pasty was tasty but the Sausage roll was so dry and hard it was pretty much inedible.  Maybe it was because we ate at 8:30pm but that should never be an excuse. I am sorry but I would not recommend this restaurant to any one.

Thank God I found this place in Arizona.. its not too much to look at from the outside but the bar area is perfect for a few drinks and to watch the football.  Being from the UK its Hilarious reading other reviews from people claiming the chips to be soggy .. if you want sugary crispy fries go to McDonalds ! This is authentic "Fish and Chips" exactly as you would get in a UK chip shop, amazing crispy batter on the fish and chips, needs lots of salt and vinegar to compliment as always. Mushy peas and gravy have always been spot on for me at this place..just like home! They even had some blackcurrant to put in my pint of Blackthorn..Nice!  Only issue for me is I couldn't clearly see the prices for the items in the shop, I didn't know how much the meat and potato pies were.

I'm sure this place is good, but my experience could've been better. I ordered the cod and chips, with fried pickles as an appetizer. The pickles were just fried pockets of oil, that exploded when you bit into them. When I got the fish & chips, the fish had a shrimp tail embedded in the fried coating.

I've visited this place about 3 times now and each time it gets better. The fish is tasty, chips are perfect just how I like them. We tried the white chocolate cheesecake and it was really great. Big enough to split with another person but I probably could've finished it on my own it was so good. Great service and great food :)

Went with a group (8 people roughly) of people on a sunday around 430p. We were the only ones in the restaurant except one person at the bar. Drinks were quick, ordered food, which took a little longer than expected but nothing to be mad about. Most ordered the fish and chips but a few ordered chicken tenders. Everything was ok, the chicken was flavorless. No seasoning on it at all. Very bland, so they covered it up with ketchup. The fish was just ok, again not much flavor but lots of grease of course. She didn't offer salad dressings so we ate plain salads unless we went over to the "store" where the waitress hangs out and asks for it. Huge issue that happens a lot is places is there was nowhere to change the baby's diaper.  I had to go to the car to change it.

Again top notch British fare ven a little store where you can buy the British goods you miss so much from home this is a little gem at 16th Street and Bell. You should not miss breakfast Saturdays and Sundays are awesome you gotta do it for a traditional English Brekkie

I haven't been in for over a year --- The remodel is EXCELLENT and classy! Gone is the spartan look in favor of upgraded tables and chairs, paint job, and expanded bar. The most AUTHENTIC English fish n chips in the Phoenix area are still served PERFECTLY! Excellent crunch, great taste. Had the large cod n chips and a sausage roll for lunch over the weekend. SCRUMPTIOUS! I wish the pastry on the sausage roll was a bit fluffier, but I could still eat those every day. You've come a long way over the 10 years I've known ya, KEEP IT UP! INSIDE SKINNY: The beer and cider list is large and SOLID, concentrating on many English and Irish brands but there are others too including those you'd find in a pub IN ENGLAND like one of my faves Fuller's London Pride on tap (1845 and Vintage Ale in bottles according to the website), Carlsberg and Estrella Damm (a Barcelona favorite). All you can eat fish on Friday. Coleman's hot English mustard on request for your sausage roll. English groceries behind the counter like chocolate, Heinz salad cream, Cadbury chocos, and beans for your toast.

These are the worst fish and chips I've ever had in my life.  I could not even cut the fish with my fork.  The fries tasted awful!  Could've gotten better at a fast food restaurant! The atmosphere is terrible and awkward. The place is very run down!  Will not be back EVER again.

Roy 'The Hungry Englishman'  For those of you who are in a rush then my 'Five Star' rating says it all, this place is the best and importantly the most AUTHENTIC 'Chippy' that I have yet to find in the US.  However as is usual with my reviews I feel a little more in-depth comments are warranted so if you feel so inclined here you go.  As you have likely guessed from my moniker I am English born and bred, although  I must say it is my very good fortune to now call this wonderful country my home.  To the surprise of my (American) wife I don't get homesick at all but it is true to say that I do occasionally crave the odd bite or two that I grew up on, fish and chips included.  To this end my ever thoughtful wife has always been keen to find me an 'authentic' fish & chip restaurant as we travel this great country and I can say that finally we found one at the Codfather in Phoenix Arizona of all places.  I have tried so called 'authentic' British fish & chips all over the country and although most have been a very pleasant meal 'authentic' they were certainly not.  For one thing if you mention 'mushy peas' they look at you rather strangely whereas this is likely one of the most common sides you can get at every single 'chippy' in good old Blighty.  And don't get me started on the battered fish (or lack there of)....aside from the batter being wrong so called 'authentic' British fish & chip restaurants here in the US are under the misguided illusion that two 'finger' sized portions of fish is the thing to offer, when anyone who has ever eaten the real thing knows that one always gets a large filet of fish (usually hanging over the edge of your plate).  Anyway enough of my ranting on about all the places that are getting it wrong and let me chat about the ONLY place I have yet found that is getting it totally RIGHT..namely the Codfather.  What can I say.....FINALLY...a real Chippy..!  The place is very unpretentious but pleasant and comfortable, I think the lady owner is British as I heard an accent in the background and sadly the opportunity to introduce myself didn't arise (perhaps next time, cuz you know I'm going back).  I ordered my standby old favorite (fish, chips & mushy peas) and I was not disappointed, everything was just like I grew up on, totally authentic, so much so I over stuffed a little and couldn't eat for the rest of the day.  The 'chippy' also has a little British grocery section in, so I took advantage and stocked up on a few goodies.  It is also worth pointing out that the price for the meal was very reasonable indeed.  This I found very pleasing as growing up in a poor neighborhood with not much money as a kid, fish & chips was always a cheap meal  (hence the phrase 'cheap as chips').  Perhaps Americans won't find the real British fish & chips to their taste and that's okay but if you really do want to experience the real thing then this is the place to go.  Whenever my wife and I travel down to Phoenix (about every six weeks) we are going to make it a priority to have our lunch at the Codfather.  I would like to say a sincere 'well done' to the proprietors for a great experience and creating a genuine bit of Britain here in the US.        Happy eating, Roy

The food is OK nothing to get too excited about the staff are more of a turnoff the  owner is  disinterested , not at all welcoming and the son is borderline  hostile. This puts a bad taste in your mouth , there are too many good places to in our city where you can have a nice meal and receive pleasant service. I would leave them to their bad moods and go somewhere else.

This is my first time and last time at this restaurant and it wasn't a good experience. My wife and I had the fish and chips for lunch all you can eat. The fish was greasy the fries were soggy and no coleslaw. The total bill was $40 which is really high all considering for lunch.

Two visits in the past two weeks, yep it's that good! The fish and chip is superb!!! Good sized portions of cod and light crisp coating. Also had the Bangers and Mash, another hit!. Place is a bit funky but that's part of the working man's restaurant charm.

"British cuisine"...this phrase is often seen as an oxymoron by Americans.  Unfortunately The Codfather does nothing to dispel this notion. First - The physical building. I was expecting a cozy, British "Local".  A pub with some personality.  The Codfather has a bar and a brightly lit dining area with cheap card tables.  So no to cozy. Second - The food.  I ordered the Haddock and Chips.  The chips (French fries) were perhaps the worst I have ever eaten.  Soggy and extremely bland.  Thank God for salt and vinegar.  If not for those two condiments the chips were like eating fried wax.  The Haddock was authentic British and I actually liked that.  The Haddock actually allowed me to give a second star As much as it disappoints me to say it given I grew up in the British Isles, I would prefer to eat Long John Silvers or Captain D's rather than this mess.  Perhaps stop by the Codfather and purchase the Haddock and then stop by Five Guys and get the fries.  Those fries remind me of the style I had growing up.

I don't like bashing or promoting negative reviews, but somethings I can't let go.  This was one of the worst meals I've ever had in a long time.  I had a craving for some fish and chips and ended giving this place a try, since its real close to my house.  Boy was that a mistake.  I can tell you right away what the big issue was...It's the OIL that they fry their food in.  My lady and I arrived to this place on a Saturday night.  They had all you can eat fish fry.  I ordered that for 14.95 and we split some jalapeno poppers/fried mushrooms and extra fries.  All of the food had a nasty aftertaste and it was due to the old oil that they fry the food in.  I come from a family of restaurant owners and I've worked the fryer station for years and I can tell that was the problem.  The fish and chips were terrible.  The batter was falling off from the fish, the fries were soggy and the other fried food was plain gross.  I was looking forward to a good Saturday night meal, but we left very disappointed and unhappy.  I would not recommend this place at all.  I should only give it one star, but the service was decent and the place felt clean.  Eat at your own risk.

This place is truly a Gem among Gems...it gets The Highest Review for a few reasons: Great Food. Very authentic English Cod and awesome Pasties!   They also have a mini English-only mart with British snacks (Smarties, Crunchies, Walkers Chips and much more) they EVEN have Barley Water if you're looking for bitterness in a bottle.   The BEST part, however, is the Bar which is NOT very big, but don't let the size and strip-mall feel deceive you, they probably have one of the best and most diverse draft beer selections in town. On Tap is NewCastle, London Pride, & Tetley's as for others they have Smithwicks, Kilt Lifter and they're always rotating great other beers in and out.   They also have a Guinness Surger which takes pure but flat Guinness and sends an ultra-sonic pulse through the pint glass, releasing the gases in the Guinness beer, which then settles into a smooth velvet pint with a creamy head. In my opinion BETTER than Guinness draft, you MUST try one!  They have a very cool Tuesday Open-Mic Night and other nightly specials. It's inexpensive, with a friendly staff and not too far off the 51 or the 101...All around a 5/5!
I had the cod & english fires. ...they were perfect...fucking perfect! If the tables were a little cleaner, I would have given 5 stars. ...I will be back again & again!

We visited The Codfather recently, not really knowing what to expect nor really having any preconceived notions, as I hadn't looked on Yelp yet.    First impressions - I was really disappointed that there wasn't more of a pub atmosphere.  The interior is very close to being fast food, and not even as nice as some.  You order at a counter and the food is delivered to your table.  I would agree with the earlier reviewers on some things.  I ordered the large portion of the Cod fish & chips.  I thought the portion size and the fish were quite good.  The batter was crispy and not greasy.  The chips were terrible though.  They were limp, soggy and tasted as if the oil should have been changed about two weeks ago.  I also had some shrimp which were good, but not outstanding.  I too was put off by the cheap "nickel and dime" approach - $.25 for more tartar sauce????  And I didn't like the $.35 surcharge for using my debit card.  I thought for a minute I was at ARCO's fish and chips!!     So, the fish was a 4, the chips were a 1, and the decor was maybe a 3.  I have to stretch to give The Codfather a 3 overall.  We will probably keep getting the fish, but for take-out.

I had lunch here and we ordered the fried zucchini as an appetizer that was yummy but the cod with chips was overly greasy, the grease is still stuck to my pallet. Sorry to say but Pete's fish and chips is better.

I have eaten here twice. I enjoy this quaint pub. A side bonus is that they serve RC Cola here, which I happen to enjoy. The first time I ate here I got the small cod with the extra 2 deep fried shrimp. The second time I was there with my cousin and we split the calamari. I got the Cornish Pasty and she got the Bangers and mash. Out of everything, the bangers and mash is my absolute favorite. Mashed potatoes with gravy, 2 sausages and peas. The Cornish Pasty was the best hot pocket I've ever had. My cod was cooked well too. My issue was with the seafood in general. Both the shrimp and the calamari had a texture I did not enjoy. Both were kinda slimy even though they were both deep fried. I feel like it was just me, but my cousin noticed that the calamari was a little different as well. Overall still really good. They have drink specials and TVs everywhere as well. I highly recommend!

The fish they use is high quality, you can see and taste it but that is about it for positive comments. We went on the 1st Friday of Lent and the place was packed. We saw a 2 top table at the bar so we grabbed it. The table was greasy and dirty, complete with a dollop of tartar sauce smack dab in the middle. The miserable bartender sluggishly came over and took our order. I guess we had to run a tab since we were sitting in the bar area bc she took our credit card when we ordered. No big deal except she when she brought it back she slapped it down right on top of the tartar sauce spill left on the center of the table. She either didn't notice or didn't care that the table was filthy bc she never wiped it down for us and she was so ornery looking we were afraid to ask her to do it for us. We were not in a crazy hurry to eat but the people around us were getting restless. Apparently, some of them had been waiting for over an hour for their order. Now, I try to be as understanding as possible but seriously? It doesn't take that long to fry fish. The nasty bartender just replied to the complaining customers that the kitchen got slammed with orders and it was taking a long time. No apology just an excuse. Ok, I get it ,they got hit with a bunch of orders at once. They were busy, I understand,  it was the first Friday of Lent but of course they were busy!!!! It is a fish restaurant on the 1st Friday of Lent! One would think that the owners would have planned their staffing a bit differently. We got our food and the bf loved his but mine was cold. On the way to the bathroom, I nearly slid to my death on a smashed french fry  or "chip" because none of the staff bothered to pick it or any of the other trash up off the floor. The bathroom is locked and you have to get a key (on a hanger) from the cashier. What kind of legit restaurant locks their bathroom like a gas station? The place is disgusting, the service is terrible, and the food is inconsistent. I don't think we'll be making a follow up trip to the Codfather.

Great Great fast Serice even if it was a bit crowded. I ordered salmon and cod small order with chips and cole slaw.  Two med sized salmon and 1 large cod  Awesome Awesome first time here I shall return.  The flavor was fresh with the deep fried crunch. Yummy if you crave fish with a crunch.  The fish did not get soggy and kept its crunch through out my meal.  Chips were super and the cole slaw was out of this world...they do something something to keep it crunchy.  Super selection of ciders.  I will need to try the rest of the menu. Well worth the trip from way up north.

Last night I was in the mood for seafood. I even thought about going to the store, buying some fresh fish, and making it at home. Then someone suggested to try The Codfather. It's not far from where we live, and was open late. So we did. The reviews online are mixed... But it was worth giving it a shot. Glad we did.  The Codfather is awesome! Such a cool little place, great atmosphere and the food looked and tasted authentic. I might have to take someone from England for the real test. Oh, and they have a lot of English beers on tap. They are all served on nitro, too, which was a nice touch.   In the end, we left full and happy, and am glad we tried it. I will go back, but take my English friends to verify the authenticity. Cheers!

Sausage roll was excellent, although a little soggy.  Cod was pretty good too, although a bit greasy.  They could easily fix this by serving on paper, but it was still pretty good.  I'd like to come back and try the meat pies sometime, its been forever since I had a proper meat pie.  They've got a small English grocery section as well.  Crisps and other goodies that are hard to come by in the colonies.  I just wish it wasn't 35 miles across Phoenix traffic to come here from where we live.  If you're in the area, though, its worth sticking your head in.  They have a pretty wide selection of food and lots of great beers to choose from.

The Codfather was one of those places I wasn't expecting too much from and got way more than I expected. I've now ate almost everything on the menu in some form or another and I have never been underwhelmed with anything I have gotten. They have a great beer selection and a fantastic selection of fried appetizers.   The fish and chips are definitely the flagship here but don't sleep on their more traditional stuff. The pies are great here and bangers and mash and all of the different "versions" of it on the menu are all fantastic. If I had to recommend my favorite dishes to a newcomer here other than the obvious fish and chips platter the "banger, bubble & squeek,  and beans" and the "beef and kidney pie" are both my favorites the deep fried sausage is also one of those things where it's so good you don't care about the heart attack it's going to for sure give you.  Pros: I have ate here at least 15 times trying most if not everything on the menu and I have never had anything bad or even so-so. Everything has been steller. As long as you understand you are eating at a fish n chip/fried food joint and not a fancy seafood resteraunt you won't be dissapointed. They also have a pretty great beer selection on tap.  Cons: Now even though I can promise you I have never ate something here that wasn't good if I seriously had to nit pick a con here it would have to be pricing. I feel like EVERY dish excluding the English breakfast I pay 1 dollar too much for. Just comparing it to similar resteraunts serving similar things this place is a little pricier than most. It's not so overpriced that it should stop you from eating here but it does prevent me from say, eating there regularly, even though the food deserves it. They also seem to have a difficult time keeping the beer they have on tap stocked regularly. Every time I sit at the bar at least one beer on tap is out. Meh. Not a big deal but just an observation.  All in all "The Codfather" is one of those places that you not only have to try but will undoubtedly make you want to come back again and again. The only reason it doesn't have the 5 star is that I can't walk in there and have a beer and meal and walk out spending less than 30 dollars after the tip. A little more than I expect when going to a place like that. But WOW they are seriously consistently great with everything they have on that menu! Highly recommended.

I know the English's reputation for bland food. If you were raised on English (read: BLAND) food, then this may be right up your alley. For someone who appreciates things with flavor, The Codfather did not impress. Like the prior reviewer's experience, there was a lot of grease and/or sogginess. The "chips" were inedible. Such a foul, bitter taste. Why?! They're french fries! And NO air conditioning?? It was SO hot in there. The beer was ok. The owner was friendly; that is why I gave 2 stars. But we will not be back. Too many other tasteful options in this town.

We went into the Codfather after hearing all the positive vibe and came away...satisfied.  The atmosphere was perfect for us. I love the look and feel of a good English pub, and while the location is a little worse for wear, it was just fine.  We had the fried mushrooms and zucchini as appetizers and I gotta say: really damn good. The garlic breading on those were amazing.  For meals we had the cod and the crab legs. The cod was admittedly just okay; if they used the same garlic breading, it would probably be amazing, but their normal beer batter was rather flavorless. The crab legs were fantastic, though.  The service was quite good, which definitely helped raise my score from 3 stars to 4. In all, we'll be back, but next time, we'll look at some shepherd's pie!

Stopped in Sunday afternoon by myself. They've done a nice remodel since the last time I was there which was about two years ago. I dont do fried and it was like pulling teeth to get the waitress to give me options. Ordered haddock and salad. Sat 20 minutes with nothing in front of me and then salad came with fish. Both were ok but not for the price and why not bring the salad out ahead? I found the atmosphere unfriendly
Best in Phoenix Shepard's Pie!  Food here is truly authentic English, highly recommend if you are looking for that.  English Pub too.

Codfather = Cod Awful!!!  Fish mushy, falling apart, and swimming in grease (not in a good way) - check.   Overdone scallops so tiny almost needed a microscope to see them - check. "Chips" that tasted like they came out of from a frozen bag purchased at the grocery store - check. Rude employees - check. Overpriced - check.  How in the hell did we spend $30+ on strip mall food?  What in the hell just happened?    From what I could see of the fish, that hadn't fallen apart from all of the oil, it seemed to be pretty good quality, which is what the one star is for.  If this is seriously what fish n' chips are like in the UK, then I feel sorry for you blokes.  Go to Rosie McCaffrey's near downtown if you want a good fish n' chip experience.
Last week my Brother bought fried fish and mozzarella sticks. The fish was falling apart with soggy fries and the mozzarella sticks were old the cheese tasted very chewy.

Stopped by the Codfather today Sunday lunch time only 2 people at a table but people at the bar. We wanted some chicken oxo which they did not have but we did learn that their import food section was way overpriced,we can buy most of those items at World Market and even our local Frys supermarket for a lot less. So we decide to stay for lunch I was going to have a brew and my wife ordered the cod fish and chips,we are seniors and do not eat a big lunch plus we need to watch our pennys. I made the mistake of telling the waitress we would share,which is what a lot of people do in the UK when buying fish and chips. She said that would be a $3 plate charge,I said we do not need two plates  we will share off the one plate in the middle. She said "It doesn't work that way it is still a $3 charge". I am going to pay them $3 so I can share a few chips with my wife?I don't think so,we got up and left and will never go back. Was it worth loosing a customer over $3 well that is what they have done,we were going to bring family there when they were in town but that is not going to happen now.

Location: In a strip mall, not very impressive on the outside Interior: At least two dirty tables at all times, odd layout with a tiny bar and a seating area for the restaurant, no host, another tiny area where they sell goods from Europe  Staff: not so friendly and knowledgable about menu(food and drinks) Alcoholic beverages: great for beer on tap & mixed drinks Food:Wayyyyyyy toooooo GREASY!!!!!!!  Everything is saturated in grease!  It's like they do not take the time to allow the oil in the fryer to get hot enough in order for the food to be cooked on the inside and for the grease to drip out when they bring it out of the fryer!!! You can see the oil float under the heavily battered & bland fried fish. Their tartar sauce and watered down vinegar is of no help! And their chips(fries)- Soggy, tasteless, limp, always cold.   You have been warned.

Pretty neat food, never been to GB before and have always wanted to try what English people eats.  My friend and I decided to come here for some delicious grub.  Every time we go to different restaurants, we always want to order Calamari and see how it taste and this wasn't that bad at all.  It's not very salty compared to other restaurants.  I never knew English people call their fries, chips, good to know that I won't call the wrong name next time.  We also ordered crab cake which was very filling.    It wasn't very crowded and the service was really excellent.  We will definitely come here again the next time we are in the area.  Great food!

My friend and I shared fish & chips and shepherd's pie. The fish was excellent. We ended up ordering more! I didn't enjoy the taste of the shepherd's pie but my friend loved it. Beware- it is served piping hot straight from the oven!   They have all you can eat fish on Saturday.

This place kinda reminds me of something on Kitchen Nightmares....  The Environment- extremely outdated. No particular theme, not very cozy or pub-like. Just random British paraphernalia throughout.  The Food- most of it was okay. Just okay. The fish was bit greasy, but certainly nothing special. The fries (chips)....were just awful. They were cold, tasteless, and frankly, worse than frozen fries.  The Service- granted it was a Friday night and it was busy, so I can't give the severs too much blame, but everything took forever! Drinks took 10 minutes, appetizers 20 minutes, then the food came out before we even finished our appetizer. We never were asked for refills on our drinks and it took 20 minutes for our server to realize we were ready to pay.  Just save yourself from the disappointment. Super cool name, but it ends there.

We stopped in for dinner this weekend.  Something happened  to move the experience from pretty good to great.  The sausage roll and shepherd's pie were amazing with a perfectly done light, flaky crust.  The fish we had was perfectly done.  Still too much footie on the tellie though.
This place has gone down hill!! The beer and the cocktail sauce was good. Way too Greasy and fish was rubbery. I could tell different cook from the last time we  were there.

I had a hankering for some fish and chips and this place hit the spot. We went early around 3:30 and not a soul was inside. I was a bit concerned about this but we ordered the Cod fish and chips, as they had an assortment of fish to select from, and we ordered some onion rings. The onion rings were amazing! They had this seasoning that they could have battered everything in and I would have been A-Ok. The fish and chips were also very decent quality. They have a small European food market type of thing and some interesting menu items if you are into English food like bangers and mash. The staff was polite and attentive. I'm sure ill be back the next craving i get.

Funky, divey, old English place, with pretty good food, but in dire need of a facelift. Had the Friday-Saturday special, all you can eat fish & chips. I should have just had the large because I couldn't eat but one piece more than originally served! Yet, the fish and chips were pretty authentic and good. The Saturday (early) evening we were there, place was packed- Every table was occupied. Good for them. Bad for me was that the service took a long time, albeit very friendly. And, my major beef, is that the entire place REALLY needs an update. Just close one Sunday and get 10 people to put up new blnds, paint, re-do EVERYTHING! Plastic picnic tables? C'mon Man. It'd be so much more pleasant, clean, and inviting if it had a facelift. I'll help.
Fun place. The food is surprisingly good and they have a good selection of drinks. There's a market inside for various English things, including big jars of marmite!

Something was wrong with the Cod Fillets......I have eaten there before and it was pretty good but the texture seemed really strange. My wife didn't finish hers, and I took mine home for the fuzz balls. Maybe it was just a bad day in the kitchen, staff were nice and friendly though. The Scotch eggs were good and that helped.

Jordan is the best bartender here !!! We always get our food so fresh and so crispy!!! The beer we like is 1664, it's sort of like a better bud light, same crispness but more flavor. I showed this place to my inlaws and we've come here every weekend since! Can't get away...

I went here with my father last weekend.  He's up for anything 'all you can eat', so I decided to join him for dinner and check it out.    The place is not fancy at all.  It's a typical strip mall- type restaurant.      We both had the 'all you can eat' fish & chips dinner and the best thing I can say about it was that I was there with my dad.   I felt that the fish was very oily and greasy-- more breading than fish, and the 'chips' were little pieces of french fries-- almost like hash browns.   You had to wait forever to get your 'fish' refilled.  It was interesting watching the cooks & wait staff eating, drinking, and chatting while we were waiting for more fish.    The place was pretty popular and filled up fast.  I wish I had tried something else on the menu, because a lot of people seemed to be enjoying their food.    I'd give it another try, even just to sit and hang out with my dad.  :)

Been here a few times in the past. Once when they first opened. On my last visit the place was bigger and now serving alcohol. Maybe that is the best way to enjoy this place to the fullest?  This is a British style restaurant with Fish and Chips the way they make it back home. My Son-in-law is from England and he LOVES this place. They have several popular items that you would get overseas. Mushy Peas, Bangers / Mash / Gravy, Bubble/Bangers/Beans and many others.  Inside is decorated with everything you would expect if you were vacationing in GB. They also have a nice market with items that you may not find in your typical grocery store.  We have had the Cod, Haddock, Jalapeno Poppers (LOL) and looking forward to possibly trying the Walleye in a future lifetime.  The food is somewhat bland tasting to my palate. Maybe that is how they like it over there. The fish seems a little more greasy than we would prefer and a napkin is needed to soak up the excess. Hmmm?  Service is friendly and the dining experience and menu are worth checking out. Would have to say that there are better places for Fish in my opinion. But then again ... this is how they do it over in the Queen's backyard. TALLY HO!  3 STARS

This place rocks.  My visit was identical to my experience eating in the U.K..   The food was great I particularly was fond of the fish and chips, the people were very nice and prompt and the place was super clean what more can you say about it. If you want to experience the British cuisine in the United States this is the place to go The Codfather ROCKS...

I was born & raised in New England, Moved to the San Francisco Bay Area, visited the UK  and later lived on Maui ,Hawaii so I know good fish & chips. I can speak with some authority when I say here in Phoenix good fish & chips is hard to find.   The good news is The Codfather Fish and chips is the way it was meant to be made.  A large crispy coating, and fries deep fried to perfection.  If you are looking for this classic dish, you will not find a better place than the Codfather. GIANT piece of fried fish and it was delicious. Crispy, soft, juicy, flavourful, perfect with a little vinegar. Amazingly delicious. the chips were golden, fluffy, crispy on the outside but not so much that they can't absorb a generous amount of malt vinegar. For the price, could you really ask for more  My wife & I ordered the cod, which was a HUGE portion and a side of large chips.  The cod was breaded and cooked to a perfectly crispy and crunchy consistency, while still maintaining the moist fish.     FOOD: I ordered the cod, which was a HUGE portion and a side of large chips.  The cod was breaded and cooked to a perfectly crispy and crunchy consistency, while still maintaining the moist fish. I can say that the fish was fresh and the oil that it was cooked in was clean. The fish was fresh as it didn't taste fishy. The fries were lightly fried and it didn't taste too oily which was a good thing. The The chips were delicious ! PRICE: For the price, could you really ask for more.CONCLUSION:  Grab that malt vinegar and pour it on, because this fish and chip stop is the one to enjoy.

I have been here a number of times in silent protest as my friends love it.  First time few times I have gone there was during the summer and there was no air conditioning on.   Last few times they had a swamp cooler which is not cool when you are trying to eat. and it did not make the crackers and cookies I purchased there at a premium very crunchy either.  I since seen that some of the items they sell are on sale all the time either at Safeway's, Cost Plus and WholeFoods.    They do seem to have slightly better air now and a bunch of wobbly old ceiling fans just ready to cool your meal down quick.   I find this place extremely expensive for what it is and what you get.   Considering you are likely to spend $10 at least on any main entree you get a surprisingly small amount of chips or is it just me???   I say that because I have recently discovered something quite shocking about the CF.   As I have already state I go here under pressure as I do have friends who like this place, US and UK friends.  For the couple of games England was playing in the Euro this year I went and had lunch at CF with my US friends.  First off even though England was playing right then... no one working was wearing anything patriotic.   3 of us in our party was from the US, and one person for the UK. We all ordered at the same time and had the same thing.  Large fish n chips.   The UK guy's meal came out 10 minutes after everyone and was a noticeably smaller.  This was not the first time I have experienced this?  I questioned the other UK people back at my company to find that the British people in my office really do not like the CF as they feel they do not get treated the same way as the Americans!   Really???   That is something I just don't get from English owned store.  I thought it was just me but it isn't.   Four people in my company are from England and we feel the same.  My American friends that go love the staff and the food.   Go figure.

We waited over  10 minutes just us have somebody say hello to us when we changed our beer our waitress right in front of us rolled her eyes.  We waited an additional half hour for our food and there was only three of the table in the restaurant we only ordered a crabcake some clam chowder soup and a meet pocket. That was it.. The meat pocket can out over done.. When I said something she replied that how they alway come out.. Saying all this the food was ok.. She also sweep the whole restaurant as we eat.. Even under our table and chairs... I've been here a few time a the food descent to good the service & ambience not so much.. Needs management.

I have eaten at the cod father many many times, I love the food the Ambiance is  average . Today I ate there for lunch and had fresh cod and chips with tartar sauce, I asked for more tartar sauce and the waitress said that will be 25 cents , I could not believe what she said the fish and chips are in themselves on the expensive side and to add $.25 for more tartar sauce is ridiculous and an insult , I asked for the manager and even though he did not agree there was nothing he could do because that was the word from the lady and gentlemen that own it, the British couple, so I checked on the menu and nowhere on the menu does it say extra tartar sauce 25cents , it's not the money it's the principle, I find that very cheap and unacceptable at the  prices they charge you should get as many tartar sauces as your need . I personally will never go back, that did it for me

I think John's 10/25/11 review is the most helpful, and so I can only share some of my observations. I think this place would be really cool if it were retro-60's British fish & chips, the sort of place Austin Powers would have gone to. *Contemporary* British is a huge problem for me if it means huge banners of Prince William or Harry or Whoever It Is & What's-Her-Name and God Save The Queen coffee mugs with the queen on it. Huge turn-off for me. I'm just glad they (England) got the 2012 Olympics because that will inevitably make for a more pleasant dining experience.   I don't like LJS's fast-food "fish" at all. I did like The Codfather's fish & chips here, tastes much better. I also liked that their silverware (even at lunch) is some damn fine china - especially for a "fish and chips" place.   I do think The Codfather would work better as a "bar" bar ONLY, or a fish & chips place ONLY, because there does seem to be a weird disconnect depending upon where you sit. The whole Sports-Game-on-TV-That-Doesn't-Match-The-Sound-(Music)-You-Hear thing that's common in a lot of places.   Based upon my experience and observations, I don't think The Codfather deserves so many negative reviews. Just doesn't describe The Codfather I went to.     Service: Acceptable/Good  Prices: Reasonable Environment: Will be better once the Olympics happen

I just had the fish and chips to go.  Both tasted like they'd been fried in month-old grease.  Maybe I shouldn't have gotten it to go because by the time I got it home the fish was soggy.  The chips were obviously of the frozen Ore-Ida' prepackaged, card board type.  The smell was very unpleasant. This was actually two step below Long John's.
I was super stoked to find out that they had swordfish & chips!! great little restaurant!  Lots of English ales and pub favorites!

Unlike other fish 'n chips places in the city, this one offers other British fare as well: bangers and mash, bubble and squeak, and more (see the menu board pic I posted). I ordered the small cod and small order of fries, plus a crab cake. The fries were cut a bit thicker than you would find at most fast food places (this does have the look of a fast food joint, except for the bar area). I had anticipated mediocre fries at most, having previously read some of the reviews here, but  the batch I got was quite good; crispy outside, moist and tender within. The same description could be applied to the fish - except that the battered cod was swimming in oil, and the fries were not. The crab cake was a good size - about the size of the palm of a hand - and just as thick, had lots of crab meat but also quite a bit of surimi (imitation crab) as an extender. That was OK, it still tasted good and I like surimi. Like the fish, though, it was drenched in oil. I'm thinking of coming back to try the other fare, or even the fish and crab cake again - they're tasty and not expensive. I just need to take the precaution of letting a paper napkin soak up much of the oil first.

This place has ruined french fries & basically anything fried for me. I had oil sitting in my mouth for hours after I left & I felt absolutely terrible. Food was not worth it. You can get the same kind of oily deep fried fish & better french fries from long john silvers for half of the price

Customer service is very poor, they gave us our appetizer at the very end of our meal and I was a little concerned about the environment as well as the quality of staff I'm not too meticulous but I do like good customer service I give it one star.

Exceptional service from Amy and highly enjoyed every single bite.  Kudos to her homemade cheesecake and made us homemade whipped cream for our Irish coffee ! Chefs were awesome and every bite was delicious !Had half BAKED and half fried fish with multiple sides!

Came here with the family on Friday. I had read the previous reviews and I was a bit apprehensive but my MIL really wanted wanted us all to have dinner here.   The area isn't great and the shopping center is older but tidy and orderly. They have two sections inside the restaurant, one for the bar (on the left) which was quite crowded and one for the restaurant (on the right) which was even more crowded :-P  We primarily came for the fish and chips. They have assorted fish (like haddock, cod, cat fish, shrimp, etc) for the fish and chips and you can either get two large pcs of fish with chips for about 10 bucks or the unlimited fish and chips for about 13 bucks (they obviously have other menu items than fish and chips, we just came for the fish). Two of us got the cod, one got the haddock and one got the shrimp, all with a side of chips.   I'm one of those weird people that has to eat each dish one by one so being a carboholic, I started on the fries. I speared two random fries on my plate, put it in my mouth and was immediately regretful. :-/ The two fries were soaked in grease/oil. It was nauseating and I almost called it quits with that bite but I didn't want to offend anybody by not eating so I kept on nibbling.  I'm so glad I kept going because the dish was AMAZING after that initial bite. The fish was light and not too greasy and the fries tasted fresh (they were slightly on the soft side but I'm weird and prefer them a little soft.) My husband had the same issue with his first bite of fries being soggy and the rest being great so all we can think is that maybe they were from the bottom of the fryer or something?   The place was PACKED by the time we got our entrees but the service was spot on. Our waiter was attentive and was knowledgeable on the menu and he even brought out some homemade sriracha sauce for us. My family members were all pretty happy with their dishes too :) (husband LOVED the shrimp!)  After dinner, we went shopping in their British "mini mart" (they have a small store in the restaurant, the size of a smallish closet) which was pretty fun, got to see a fun assortment of British food products and candy.   Fun experience, we will be back! But watch out for that first bite of fries ;-)
great food great service great atmosphere.  Best Fish and chips out side of the UK. you cant go wrong eating here...

I've been here 4 times before they had full-service & now with the friendly service staff. Each time we've been there, food has always been the best.  I can also get my Horlicks malted milk from the little but well stocked UK products corner.  Our favorite is the Haddock and Cod fish & chips. Mushroom appetizer and the Clam Chowder.

First time and love it.  I lived in Europe for 6 years and this place reminded me of being back there.  If you would expect some high snotty joint then don't come here.  Cod was large and meaty, the fries crispy and you can taste the oil (and that's a good thing) but not greasy.  It's hard to explain,  especially if you've never been in England.  Judy was very attentive and knowledge of the menu. Will defiantly be back to try something else.

I have been coming to Cod Father for many years. At first it was just for the beer, but I ventured out and started trying the fish and chips combos. When they have it, I get the tilapia and chips. The breading is never too much and the fish is fresh-- it doesn't have that firm texture from being frozen. Plus, the tartar sauce is made daily or every other day, so it doesn't have that overly preserved flavor like some seafood chains. I don't care for the shepherd's pie, but the English Breakfast is filling and always delicious! It was a weekend entree that made its way into the weekdays. They have a small bodega that is stocked with novelties from across the pond. My favorite thing about this place is the atmosphere. The staff is personable and the restaurant doesn't ask too much from their guests. Show up hungry and leave happy.

The fish n chips where bloody lovely, the curry sauce and mushy peas are also just like from ole Blighty. If you want authentic British fish n chips I would highly recommend this place. They do all you can eat fish n chips on a Friday and Saturday if you are really hungry.

I tried, I really did. I tried to like this place. I've never been to England, and I'm afraid to go if the food is like this.   My sixth (or so ) visit to the Codfather was on Saturday for lunch. I had the large cod plate. As always, the food was way too oily. It really tastes the fish and chips were coeked in too old oil, at too low of a temperature. The breading on the fish is too thick and should use something, maybe even salt, to give some flavor.

Fish is very good and the chips are good if you don't get them to go. The bar area has a good selection of beers on tap (Kronenbourg being my favorite) The staff are friendly and the prices reasonable. As other reviewers have said - the decor is simple, and does remind me of Fish and Chip Shops back in England (I am an ex-pat) The grocery section has a decent selection and you can find some decent imported English foods

Best fish and chips in town by far. They have many other English/Scottish/Irish food options as well. Their beer selection is by far the best in Phoenix. Service is always good. If you don't like greasy food, don't order fried food, derr!

This was my Foodie Friday stop with a friend yesterday. I was so excited to try this place. I haven't had good fish & chips since I visited England years ago and this place was recommended and I must say it's the best fish & chips I've had since I visited England. The batter was light, crispy and flaky. Delicious! I tried the scotch egg and it was ok. Kind of bland. Also tried the sausage roll. It wasn't what I expected and it wasn't bad but tasted more like stuffing than sausage. So I guess like a sausage stuffing. Lol!! All in all it was good and if return for the fish & chips alone but there are other British meals I'd love to try there.

Terrible. Had fish and chips all you can eat and it was dry and bland. When I didn't eat it and told the waitress she just shrugged and said that was too bad. So I went to another person who appeared to be the owner and she said it wasn't their fault I didn't like it and they wouldn't charge for the me regular price for the meal and continues charged me more for the all you can eat anyway. Rude service they don't give a sh

I'm not even sure this establishment deserved one star. We went in for a late lunch and there were us and another table and after waiting an hour and watching others get food we asked where our food was and their explanation was that everything is made to order I guess my thought is unless the flew all the way to Boston and back to get the fish it's not even acceptable to wait that long. I'd hate to see what it looks like when it's full. And although we didn't get to try the food we were glad at the end because the people handling the food and the servers were dirty and they had  very little customer service. Highly recommend avoiding this place.

Divey kind of place for authentic standard English pub fare. Has my favorite English ciders and ales, which are hard to find in the desert. Fries are the homemade type, but not overly greasy. Fish is good, we had a fish and chips plate for $8.90 and were offered a couple of shrimp for a $1 more.. THAT didnt impress. The shrimps were ''shrimpy'', as in tiny and not tasty. Also shared the standard pub bangers and mash. Very good and like I had in London. The ambience, umm , not pubby. The bar, not great.. BUT its what you want when you want it. Staff was awesome, maybe a bit slow, (the lady ordered after us got the same thing and got her order about 10 min before we did).. Again, its a place for your yang for English fare and brew..

Waited 20 minutes to have someone come over and get drinks and take our order. Once that was done did not see our waitress for 40 minutes until she brought the food out and at that time we got refill on water.   Got the haddock with chips and was a huge disappointment. There is absolutely no flavor in the fish and the vinegar is really light and no flavor and the chips are just the worst.   Really would not recommend if your looking for English food there are a lot of better places out there.
I want to thank Cassie,  for the first time in 10 yrs I came to the cod father and I really enjoyed the curry turkey pie. U must try it

Take a trip to GB without leaving AZ!  If you are looking for the ambience of an English pub, you won't find it here. If you are looking for authentic English pub food, you WILL find it at Codfather's! (We've traveled to the UK many times and enjoyed traditional pub food a lot. I don't consider myself an authority, but I do feel comfortable making the claim that Codfather's is authentic). They even have a little area set aside selling authentic British candy, sauces, teas, biscuits, and more!   Of course, fish and chips is the first thing that comes to min when thinking pub food, and Codfather's does not disappoint. Cod, catfish, Mahi Mahi, salmon, haddock, halibut... grilled or fried? Small or large? One doesn't get that many options in the UK!! Plus, you get a side dish - how about mushy peas or baked beans? So British!
