Or perhaps you fancy meat: they offer pies, pasties, sausage, etc. And of course, you can get bangers and mash, or bubble and squeak,  or a ploughman's platter or even an English breakfast.   The portions sizes are very generous. The small fish and chips is big, the large order is bigger! But the ultimate deciding factor is taste. Again, no disappointment. The fish was fried perfectly, not greasy at all and the batter is delicious. The Cornish pasty was huge (half went home to enjoy the next day.)  The beer selection is awesome, too (some bottled, some on tap.) I've never found John Smith's Extra Smooth anywhere else in town!! In addition to the other UK beers (Boddington's Guinness, Fullers), they offer domestics such as Bud & Coors (why, I have no idea!!) as well as small selection of wine.  Service was great, prices are very reasonable and friendly/welcoming staff. Don't be deterred by the location - make your way to 16th & Bell, and enjoy great pub food at this family owned restaurant.

With a name like the cod father your cod fish and chips should be transcendent. Alas the batter was lacking flavor.  This place seems to be much more than just fish & Chips, it also doubles as a small English grocery and had many other brittish favourites.   For the price and bland flavor I would not give this a high reccomendation.

Love this place. The fish and chips are crispy and good. Love the Cornish pasty too. The bangers and mash really fill one up--I had to try the mushy peas and LOVED 'em!! The little grocery in the restaurant has lots of Brit staples too. Good beer selection. I'm glad they recently remodeled. The owners are very nice too.Next time I will try the Scotch eggs...

Ate at the bar here last night.  The food is great, beer selection is awesome, and the staff is friendly. I met a couple of regulars too and even they were nice! I couldn't help but notice the whiskey selection wasn't bad either! I will return here the next time I want fish and chips for sure!

Yes Yes yes Yes Yea Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes Yes!!! Everything is just awesome! Staff, clientele, owner, food, drink, prices! Wish it were closer to my house but so good I make the twenty minute drive without complaint

After running a few errands, decided to stop by on my way home. It's just a few blocks down, and was hoping to find a neat "British Style" pub. When I walked in, the bartender was very nice, and filled my Guinness order (nothing like a good pour!) I ordered the haddock per his recommendation.  As I was waiting, a very loud man was talking around the side of the bar. I was not really paying attention until he kept getting louder and louder, then said some disparaging comments about certain people in the current election. Now- I know tempers are running high this year, but I don't want to be sitting in a place listening to loud people make ignorant comments. I voiced my objections, and he told me to shut up and mind my own business. (I guess he goes there often)  He and the bartender then proceeded to talk about a certain gift store, and other places where you can get sex paraphernalia. My lunch arrived, and I ate as quickly as I could. It was hot, fresh and tasty.   I will probably not have any compelling reason to go back if this is the type of conversations that people feel are acceptable when there are female customers sitting by.  But hey- It's just "Locker Room Talk" right?

Of all the places that I've eaten Fish and Chip in the USA this is by far the best.   The building and actual restaurant was disappointingly American looking despite the picture of the Queen and other UK inspired decoration. I wasn't that hopeful for the quality of the Fish and Chips.  Order was taken by an obvious Brit so my exceptions raised a bit. When the food came it looked just like you'd get in good old blighty. Portion size was good.   The fish came as it should in one piece with the batter lovely and crispy and the fish wonderfully moist and flaky. Chips were proper chunky chips not those horrible 'fries'   If I had one criticism of the place I'd say it was the decoration... its too 'Rule Britannia' maybe thats what Americans want/like but I think it would look better if they made it a bit more like a UK chippy i.e 'Cool Britannia'  Anyway this place is now in my address book for future visits!

We decided to give this place a try, this is very average to us but you might think different fish left an Itch in both our mouths....and we thought we might get sick but didn't, It was OK but not great from what we had,..I think if you are looking for British groceries this is fine...maybe the other foods they offer are better?....I don't know...we just wanted to try....but they were crowded....maybe they are normally better   As a slight update I think we had itchy throats from all the oil in the air....we aren't used to that...the air was itchy and we kept coughing.   The fried fish was tasty...we had cod and Maui Maui (the Maui Maui was sort of fishy tasting the cod was better) his fries were hot and fresh mine were old and cold. Thankx Guys!

I see many mixed reviews for The Codfather but must say that for the dozen or so times that I've been in for lunch or dinner or both my wife and I have been in for dinner, we've truly enjoyed the food and service (usually served by Jordan since we eat at the bar).  We've tried pretty much everything on the menu and have found the fish and chips (especially haddock) to be moist, flaky and delicious every time ordered...which is every time for my wife. Sheppard's pie is large, juicy, piping hot with plenty of meat and mashed potatoes to satisfy and the pasties (meat pies) are always spot on.   The best part of the establishment is the selection of Irish and English beers on draft and/or bottles. They serve beers I've never seen on draught before anywhere, not even New York or the Princeton, NJ area which has numerous British Pubs and frequented in the past. I won't go into detail as to selection but if you're a fan of a nitro draft which is as smooth as silk when poured and enjoyed, this is the place to enjoy! Trust me on this one!  There's usually a game on one of the 3 TV's in the pub area and usually a few locals @ the bar to share a story or two but always seem to find new people to meet and enjoy a pint whenever stopping in. This is not an authentic English Pub but certainly has atmosphere and the food, drink and service to make you feel welcome. Mark and his family have done a great job bringing a slice of England to Phoenix with The Codfather. Enjoy!
Fantastic fish, shrimp, chicken strips. A little grease never hurt anyone, right ?  I go once a month. It's always a great experience.
Go for the food, not so much the service. Also, try not to go on a Friday or Saturday night. Seems to be understaffed. Fish and Chips were good.

We eat here a lot, and love the food!  No matter how busy the place is, the service is good and the staff is friendly.  Try the all you can eat cod on the weekends...you'll be busting at the seams when you leave!

Talk about the most expensive uninspiring place! Apparently seasoning is not practiced in food preparation here and soggy fries constitute "chips". I thought the waitress was considering suicide and if I had to collect money from poor souls that I fed that to, I guess I would consider it as well. If you don't like your money and hate flavor, it's time to pack up the family and head to Codfathers.

Fish was pretty good. Fries were soggy, not sure if that is the "English" style. One of  my kids didn't like the chicken and fries on the kids meal, the other one liked the fish, not the chips. It was also hot in the restaurant, no A/C on. Cool atmosphere though. Server was friendly.
Just had some very tasty haddock with chips and mushy peas. Soul food for an ex pat Brit! Washed down with draft Union Jack IPA from California.

Fish and Chips.  Today, I was in the mood for seafood. A work associated  suggested I try "The Codfather". The reviews online for "The Codfather" are mixed however, I thought it was worth giving it a shot.  The Codfather is unpolished, and unpretentious.  The atmosphere is very relaxing and welcoming.  As I  sat muling over the menu I enjoyed listening to the random music being played.   The customer service at "The Codfather" is really good.  My  server was accommodating without being intrusive and  took the time to explain the menu.  I decided to try the fried cod and it was very good. The cod was fresh, crispy, and not greasy. The Cod combo comes in two sizes small and large. The small has one piece of cod for $7.50 with chips ( fries). The tarter sauce was amazing and I'm usually not a big fan of tater sauce  The service and food were all good. It might not be the best fish and chips I've had however I'm looking forward to.going back again.

Great neighborhood bar to grab a quick fish & chips and a draft. It's good. For fried food that's quick what can really go wrong? Have the right expectations when you walk in and enjoy a variety of fish and chips they have there.

Went here for lunch today with a couple of friends.  They seem to be big fans of this place.  2 of us ordered cod and chips and one ordered tilapia (he was not very pleased with the tilapia and vowed to stay with cod in the future)  They brought a bowl of complimentary potato chips to the table. I didn't time it but it seemed to me that it took a little too long for our order to come out.  I didn't think the food was particularly tasty, but the tartar sauce made it better, I also asked for some lemon I also think the food needed some salt, which may be good for those limiting their salt intake.  We asked for split checks and that was OK (nice of places suitable for lunch to be flexible with split checks), and  I almost missed to notice our server charged me for a drink when I had only water. They fixed it but it took a little while (probably over 5 minutes)  I won't probably come here on my own but if I the guys want to come over for lunch again, I will be back.  Oh, for beer fans, they seem to have a very good variety (about 60)

This is a quaint little place for fish that gets super busy! It is adjacent to the N.Y. Barber shop in case you need a cut (It is the only place I go to for a buzz). The Codfather is all British based fare.   I had my first Cornish Pastry. They are like fat Pop Tarts loaded with your favorite goodies. They also call them Meat Pies. The menu is loaded with all of your favorite Fish and Chip conceptions and much, much more.  Being old school, you won't find Coke or Pepsi here. This is a throw back to the days of RC Cola. I hate to say this but every once in a while you have too. If you are pretentious, only eat in certain areas of town that qualify, you carry a dog in your purse or have a heated toilet seat, PLEASE stay away. We do not want you ruining the vibe...  The staff here are awesome and you feel like mom is getting ready to yank chow out from the oven at home. It is very comfortable and I had heard nothing but good reviews prior to my visit. Fish fans, give them a shot.   #irishcatv2 #vino2 #vino2ultimate #scottsdale #vinosquared #rebelfoodandwine #codfather

I've lived near this place for almost 8 years and finally decided to give it a shot.  My husband and I both like fish and chips but he prefers super thick batter and I prefer mine to be thin so we never both like fish and chips from the same place.  This was a great compromise between both of our styles.  He liked the batter and I didn't find it overwhelming like I usually do when he likes it.  It was crisp and (shockingly) flavorful.  What I usually run into with fish batter is it tastes like nothing or it tastes like beer.  This stuff was good.  I got mashed potatoes with mine, my husband got fries.  Both were good.  I did not like the gravy that came with the mashed potatoes - it tasted like salt soup.  But the mashed potatoes didn't need gravy at all - they were great!  Service was friendly.  We were there at 2:30 in the afternoon and I was surprised by how busy it was at that time.  They do all you can eat fish and chips on Fridays and Saturdays - I might look into that next time. Good stuff!
Yuck. Grease infested grossness.  Really bad.
Just ate there for lunch today and it was... decent. The Cod was pretty good, but the fries were awful. I had better Fish & Chips at TGI Friday's last week. Truth.
This is a terrible restaurant. Over priced for what u get. Beans and slaw straight out of a container. Fish greasy. Not worth the money. Will not go back. Left hungry.

Cod bland--NO seasoning, and portion not generous (for the large cod--which means two small pieces). Ask for extra-crispy. Chips are just American fries, not the thick chunky hand-cut pieces you get in the UK.  Please, Codfather, consider salt!  Many imports they carrry are out of stock, no matter when you come. Pleasant atmosphere, nothing special.
I always found the cod to be greasy. Good but greasy.   Maybe I should try something else?

This is my go-to place for fish & chips in Phoenix. I wasn't sure what to expect my first visit, but their food is great! The fish is tasty and the service is friendly. I recommend this place to anyone looking for good English style fish & chips!

This review is for the British grocery/snack section.  It's just a small assortment of candies, chips, condiments, etc, tucked into a corner near the register, but I was happy to find some favorites.  I got some Tango apple soda, which I love.  I also picked up a bottle of HP sauce for cheaper than it costs at my local grocery store's international section.  They have a few frozen items supplied by Cameron's British Foods like sausages and meat pies.  It was slightly cheaper for me to purchase those from the Codfather than directly from the mail order company, so that was nice too.  I'll be back now and then whenever I'm craving another Tango or other British snack.  Haven't eaten in the restaurant, so can't comment on that.

Have driven by this place a thousand times and recently had a customer tell me how good it was so we have been looking forward to trying it.  Unfortunately we are one and done.  It gets a star for having nice cold beer and a tremendous selection.  Like everything though it is a little pricey.  We got a jalapeno popper / fried zucchini  appetizer that was OK.  We also got two orders of the Cod and chips and were greatly disappointed.  The cod was greasy and not that flavorful.  I have had my share of bland meals in the UK on many trips but its usually fresh.  This was not.  After we ordered, I saw the chips on another customer's plate and knew we were in trouble.  They may have been the worst "chips" or fries I have ever had.  They were cold and must have been cooked hours before.  I have always said I would eat anything that is fried and that is no longer true.  Its sad when a tiny amount of effort isn't expended to make something worthwhile.  Is it really that hard to make some fresh fries when people order them?  There were only 3 tables of people in the place so it wasn't like they were overwhelmed.  The people were very nice but the food could not be eaten.  We both felt sick the rest of the night over the little bit we actually did force down.  The bill ended up being $50 before tip for one appetizer, 4 beers and two cod and chips.  Painful if its good.  Brutal when its not.
Pretty darn good fish and chips. The cod is prepared just the way it is in England. The chips (French fries) could be better, but this place is worth a stop for the fish.

My sister and brother I laws' favorite hang out - and now one of our favorite places! The Fish N Chips are amazing, the atmosphere is great a truly friendly staff. Looking for a simple and friendly pub with great food? Put this on your list to check out. You'll be glad you did! Cheers!

Being from the UK it is not easy to find good English food here in Arizona. The Codfather got it right. The fish & chips and the steak & kidney pudding are really good. Great selection of beers & ciders. Very friendly staff. Reasonable prices. (If you don't believe me try Gordon Ramsey's pub in Vegas) Highly recommend.

Decent fish and chips- the all you can eat version was a pretty good deal.  My biggest issue is that I like for the breading to stay ON my fish. It was a bit on the bland and oily side even after I doused it in malt vinegar. Is British malt vinegar less potent than the US version? The tartar sauce did taste homemade though. Overall this is probably the second or third best fish and chips I've had in the valley. Love the Lego table for the kids to play at!

Ordered the fish and chips and half of my order was just the shell of fried batter without any fish in it and the other half the fish just sat on top of some batter. Who ever is putting the flour on the fish is not doing it correctly. The fries had no salt although they were cooked well and the side of shrimp was very good though.

Looks really cool from the outside, but once you're inside it looks kind of run down and doesn't really live up to be 'hype'.   Was looking forward to a nice dinner sitting on some booths, but the only place to sit was just the regular chair and table, no "comfortable dining".   After a few minutes and drinks being served to us shortly(we were the only ones there) we weren't sure if we were suppose to order our food up front or wait until the waitress comes back.. We got there at 5:50pm which was perfect; 10 minutes before their special $5 fish n' chips were done. Unfortunately, the waitress didn't come back until we went and got her to make sure we made it in time for he special. At 6pm we gave her our order but she came back saying at 6pm on the dot the system shut her out of the fish n' ship special...   So I come all the way there for a special, I order at within the last minute because she took to long to come back over... And when push comes to shove they couldn't even override the price. So instead of paying $5.50 each for fish n' chips, I paid $10 EACH for my gf and I to eat. The waitress was slow and didn't even offer to edit the price..just simply stated... "Sorry the system locked me out and we can't do the $5 special any more".  I call that HORRIBLE customer service and a pathetic excuse for a business. I was there before 6pm and was not honored the $5 special. Luckily, i just wanted to eat and didn't want to stress over a huge confrontation.... but yes...I was PISSED.   THAT BEING SAID, the food was good. Atmosphere is not so good. Maybe if you want to go hit up the bar that's connected around the wall. That is if drinking alcohol with the stench of fish is more appealing than a real bar with a pool table and darts...

Went for the first time and month ago. We didn't wait to long before the server took our order and then 15 minutes later discovered she had not turned in the order. Then piece of cod I was served was terrible, you could not cut it with a fork or knife. Never going back and would not recommend.

Love fish and chips - just not here.  The fish was cooked nicely but totally under seasoned.  My biggest complaint is the watered down vinegar.  If you are going to serve Sarsons in a Sarson container then it should be authentic and original.

Will make this short and sweet - nice peeps, ok food.  I have been on a seafood kick and I really wanted fish and chips. I happened to be on that side of town and saw this as I was driving past, remembering reading a review on  yelp a while back...tires screeching, I did my infamous U-Turn that's made hubcaps on my old '67 Mustang roll off onto the side of the road...luckily I now drive a car that doesn't lose hubcaps so easily. ;)  Stopped in and got fish & chips and some water. The water was good. :D  The fish and chips were ok. People have complained about the greasiness, but I'll be honest...if the fish and chips aren't greasy, I get worried. When I lived in the UK, fish and chips were always greasy.  The fish was nice - I got cod...I'd love to give their other stuff a shot when I am on that side of town again. I'd also like to bring along hubby since he's a discerning Brit. He can drink the beer and tell me if it's good or not. ;)

Horrible service, new england calm chowder came and no liquid, nasty person said that's how we make it , it was gross,no offer of I'm sorry not empathetic short man little d*** man came out he was rude !!!! How this dump stays in business is beyond me  we paid our bill and left ....don't go !!!! NEVER ORDER CHOWDER THERE IT'S NOT

Friday night dinner with family, had no expectations or idea it was a British bar and grill. I just expected to eat fish, but made the right choice to select the Sheppard pie! I did pick at the kids fish and chips, so fresh and not bready( goog thing)

Horrible soggy batter and chips which taste nothing like the real thing.  For anybody who has not been to England this is not what real fish and chips taste like.  They are an embarrassment to us ex-pats who know they as passing this off as authentic English food.  They used to be much better but do not seem to care anymore.
Cod n fries. Looked great but after we were done we felt like we drank a pint of grease. Felt sick all night.
I went here thinking that this would be a wonderful place for fish and chips the fish was so soggy it was awful the only reason that I can think anyone would come here as for the beer

We hit this place on a Saturday night around 8p. There is a restaurant side and a bar side that is divided in a very awkward way. Plus in the restaurant, it looks like it is counter service, but it was sit down service. I actually don't have a preference between the two  as long as the food is good. We have all had subpar food from a sit down place and great food for a counter place. My only point in bringing this up is that the whole layout of the place is just weird. It could really use a makeover.  Now getting to the food-I went with a small fried haddock, chips (i.e. Fries), and mushy peas. It has been a few years since I have been to England or Ireland so I can't make a good comparison as to what you would get over there. But I can say that I really enjoyed the food I got. The fish was nice and meaty, the batter was tasty, and the malt vinegar at the table had a nice zing to it that seems to be missing from the regular grocery store malt vinegar you can get here. My old lady had the beef sheppards pie.  Ironically, I thought the sheppards pie looked very nice, but tasted average, while the presentation on my fish and chips was not good but it tasted very nice. I would have liked for the fish to come in a basket, lined with paper, that sort of thing. Just to make it look like something they are proud to serve (which they absolutely should be-again, it was very good). With it being on a plate, it just kind of comes off as "look-here's your damn fish".  One other thing-the small portion is really a perfect size as the large is huge. Even though it was all fried food, I didn't feel like I was overloaded and would have my stomach angry at me.  They scored big points with me by having Murphy's on tap here, and it tasted great. For those of you not in the know, Murphy's is to the city of Cork, Ireland what Guinness is to the rest of Ireland. No, I can't say which is better because I have never tasted them side by side. But you can get Guinness on tap in a million places, and I have never seen Murphy's on tap outside of Ireland.  They do have the area of items you can buy. Many of them you could probably find in World Market, but I imagine not everything.  To sum up, I think they have the main things correct in the fish, chips and Murphy's. It would be great if they made some cosmetic changes to the restaurant and the presentation of the food. This place is nowhere close to where we live, but I am sure we will be back.

If I could give this place zero star I would.   Ordered some crab cakes. They taste like salmon. I took 1 bite and sent them back to kitchen. Manager insisted that I pay half something I sent back.  He didn't care about the customer service of the horrible representation of food. He said there's nothing wrong with it. I had to pay. He surely didn't give half the dish back. Get a better cook and more friendly staff.
OMG, simple (wish it had any level of ambiance) But fantastic Fish and Chips.  Great neighborhood quality ole brit style.  Just roll in newspaper and I'm across the pond.

This place is awesome!  It is a little pricey, but sometimes they have an all-you-can-eat fish and chips special for about $10 which is totally worth it.  The food is authentic, I haven't had fish and chips this good anywhere else in Phoenix (especially not at Pete's) the chips are cut thick, the fish is fresh and tastes hand battered, the fillets are whole. Plenty of tartar sauce and malt vinegar too.  If you're into beer, the place has a great selection of Euro brews. There's Soccer on the TVs, they sell all kinds of awesome Irish and Scottish and British foods, and they have some of the wildest flavors of Potato Crisps from England also.  The place is absolutely packed on Fridays, so expect a wait. They also close a bit early, like around 8pm typically. So plan your trip. It's worth the trouble.

The food was suprising delicious, I'd previously heard that British food was terrible. Anything that they fry has the best batter and the Scotch Egg w ordered was fantastic. We definitely plan on going again and trying more of the food.

My mother was British, so we always had to get Fish 'n Chips when I was growing up.  I wish we would have had this place around back then.    It's pretty decent Pub-style Fish and chips.  They have lots of good brews to go with it as well!  It's not close to my home, so I have to go out of my way to eat there...which is actually funny, since Oscar's Pier 83 is almost right across the street from me (they just aren't quite as good!).

The chicken wings and haddock where so bland!! The waitress gave us poor service and messed my order up, I hate cod and she brought that out; and then took forever to give my husband his refund! We won't be recommending anyone here!!The best yeah right if you know flavor and your a fish lover like my husband and I!! If I could give The Codfather a half star I would.....For service and lack of flavor!!!!

So I've gone here a few times in the past, but after my last experience...NEVER AGAIN!  What a jerk the owner is!  Since I would go in once in a while for the haddock and chips I figured I'd get their restaurants.com coupon where it is $10 off.  I go in with my girlfriend and show the coupon.  Immediately there is a problem.  I have used restaurant.com coupons dozens of times and there has never been an issue.  The manager talks to me and explains they don't allow the coupn on any items on the specials list and a bunch of other things they won't accept it on, limiting my selection to about three items.  None of which I like/want.  It doesn't say anything on the coupon about this and then the owner (the British dude) comes over and angrily expresses that they never wanted to be on that site and they are not honoring the coupon anymore.  I made the point in a calm manner that I've been a loyal customer and he says he doesn't care and won't accept the coupon.  Why not?  It is out there.  I purchased it.  Nothing on there says it is limited to certain items.  $10 is $10.  If he accepted it I would have spent plenty of money on that visit, plus future visits.  Never again will I give them my money.  I don't support jerks whose food is just average at best anyway.  Might be the only place to get haddock, but it isn't worth it.  PS-It isn't the only place to get Haddock in Phoenix.  Wanna know where?  Message me and I'll tell you.

To be fair, I have no other experience with most of the items on their menu to compare with. That aside, I have yet to taste something here I didn't love. The Cornish Pasty Co. may have more variety and an edge on pasties, but still no North valley location...

This is a great place to get authentic English style fish and chips. They have other English specialties as well like bangers and mash, etc. They also have an English style pub so you can get a beer or cider to wash it all down.

This place is the real deal when it comes to authentic  fish and chips. The owners Mark and Ruth are wonderful.  If you come on the weekends they have all you can eat fish and chips for about $12.95..  the atmosphere  is casual dining with a built in bar attached. Try the scotch eggs as an appetizer. .so good. They also have a mini store featuring  English  goods.

A great food find my boyfriend and I stumbled upon  This place has the best fish n chips, very thick fish fillets, choice of fish for entree i felt so stuffed after just one fish. it was too good to deny myself another.

I have traveled the world, including UK.  It's rare to find a great fish and chips place stateside, but this qualifies.  The cod is fresh (I believe) and the batter crispy...douse with vinegar and salt...delish...I'll be back

Good small English pub/dive bar. My hubby and I went there out of curiosity, and we had a good time there. Wasn't sure what we were expecting, and it wasn't a disappointment. So that's good news! Fish and chips are really good, and they have a good selection of beer. Most of the beer are irish...which I'm not complaining one bit :)
Food is from England. Love the sausage rolls and you can buy em frozen to take home too!

I swear, he looked a lot like Walter. Only the people there will know what I am talking about.  Popped my Codfather cherry last night.   Friendly staff and good service.  Enjoyed the Bangers and Mashed.  Well prepared, hot, and tasty. I will be back.

If you crave English pub style fish and chips, You will find it here.... Plenty of it, and in many varieties. They fry up cod, haddock, catfish, mahi mahi, and salmon as well as salmon or crab cakes.  I've tried the haddock.  It's very good fish, but hard to escape the gallons of oil.    They serve sausages of many types.  Saveloy and Bangers, Battered sausage on a stick.....   They have traditional side dishes, like mushy peas, bubble, cole slaw, pickled eggs and mashers.  They make scotch eggs, chicken curry, and several combination plate dinners as well.   They have pies, but not the kind of pies one would find in England.  These are the packaged "fast food" version from Australia.  They are good for mass produced pies, but not better than one would expect to pop out of the freezer.  Don't go to the Codfather for the pies.  Go for the fish and chips.   On Saturday and Sunday from 8am to noon, they serve a Full English Breakfast for $8.99.  This consists of eggs, both bacon AND sausage, either beans or a thick slice of fried tomato, bubble (the sort of veggies leftover from a roast dinner with cabbage fried up with potatoes), mushrooms, black pudding, and fried bread.  It isn't fancy...  The place is in a small strip mall and has large windows, fast food booths and tables, a TV on the side, and lots of magic market or painted posters hawking new treats or specials. If your comfort food is something British, you will find it here.... if not, go for the fish.

Saw this place referenced on my friend's FB wall.  We been searching for a place to get Fish n Chips, so we thought we would check it out.  Well, this is place is a very British inspired.  We ordered several items to try/share:  Sausage Roll, Scottish Egg, Fish n Chips and Shepherd's Pie and bread pudding w/custard.  Now, this was my first time trying Shepherd's pie, seen it a thousand times on TV food shows...this was not your ordinary creamed mash potatoes on top of the "stew (sorry don't know how better to describe the ground meat and brown sauce)".  The mashed potatoes were baked with a little crust of cheese and actually had small diced potatoes too, which gave a nice texture contrast.  The stew was well seasoned and very flavorful.  Also, the sausage roll had minced meat and seasoned well.  That, I would come back for...However, the Scottish egg was not as crispy as I would have liked but it was good.  Also, the Fish n Chips were a little on the greasy side and the chips (French fries) were very soggy, not fresh nor crispy.  Personally, I've never had bread pudding before and I'm not a big dessert person, but the bread pudding w/custard was good and tasty.  The dining area was clean and the service/waitress was good, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here.  It does have a bar, that appears to be frequented by locals/regulars, which could be fun.

Wonderful dinner last night, the fish and chips are awesome. Friday nights it's all you can eat for $10.95. My wife liked the small British store for treats and goodies. We definitely plan on being back.

OI!   This is great food. I have had several types of fish here, the cornish pastie, the bangers and mash ( excellent!), Scotch Eggs, and the English Breakfast, which is sadly, no longer with us.  The owners are Brits, and they explained that there were no fish n chip shops in Phoenix, so I, for one, am very glad they opened this place.  A fine selection of beers and british treats rounds out an awesome restaurant, in fact, the only reason they don't get a 5 is the lack of English Breakfast. I want my Blood Sausage, damnit!

Never in this area. Used yelp and couldn't be more disappointed.  Has no one ever had real fresh food before? The crab was imitation crab and the fish and chips where just blah. Service was good but the food was horrible. Will not be back

I have to start with an old UK Joke.   "How did you find the steak and kidney pie? "     "I moved a chip...    The plusses. They have hard cider:) The chips are not those evil stringy jokes  that  pass for fast food places "or the  crisp and crunchy variants they are pretty  close to decent home made chips  but  having grown up in the uk and eating this for  3-4 years during college   ( and they wonder why Scots have the most heart disease  outside of  New Orleans:))   this is  not just like home.       This is still very much  fish and chips at the "sit down"   rather than take out level. E.g   They are adequate but  didn't kick me back  nostalgia wise and  so far in the US I've not found decent ( aka bad:)  UK food that didn't come out of one or two suppliers  in the states and was lovingly heated to the same directions.   The steak and kidney pie, holy heck it was lame. I'm eating offal here so you have to give me some credit for knowing when the piss is being taken.   It's not an fully enclosed pie like they would serve in the UK which is finger food meant to be consumed on the move which doesn't describe this 80% crust to filling ratio at all.  This needs a fork, and  not that big a one cos three  trawls of the pieplate was all I  got out of it.  So far the only place that has gotten remotely  close to UK pastry  is the  Cornish pastie co in Tempe. Seriously this alone took it from 3 to 2 stars.If it cost $2 more but actually contained the advertised ingredients in identifiable lumps I'd be happier as it is less insulting  in the long run.   Nearly everyone else fakes it  and cooks a filling, then crust and marries them later  to heat. Having ketchup in packets is just bloody annoying, not having brown sauce out  likewise.       Hint  Cross the road. Go to the Indian grocery , to their freezer  section and get their steak and kidney pie /  steak pie /  any pie   , Go to Codfather for chips,  stick the two together.

so sadly mediocre i had to just take one star off. The food left me feeling disgusting afterwards.  Most fried foods do, but you know when there is more batter than fish, and oil than batter that your food isn't going to be good.   If i could go back in time i would have walked next door and gone to Spinatos nuff said.  there really isnt any type of PR at all going on. Infact you have to initiate everything. Go up to the counter and say what you want. Don't wait to be asked, don't ask what they like cause they wont really respond...but maybe they were giving me an honest answer cause i certainly didn't like anything here.

Honestly, this review is tricky to write, because I'm not really a big fan of British cuisine. I don't like fried fish, kidney pie, bangers, or much of anything beyond a good sausage roll (which they do quite well here). It's just not really my thing.  My Mom, however, who is about as British as tea and crumpets, gave her seal of approval after eating some of their shepherd's pie during a recent visit. Bangers and mash? Only so-so. Their custard-based desserts are also worth mentioning, as we've tried both the banana bread and more traditional pudding. Both are decent if that's your thing.  I can't speak for the pub-side, as I don't really like beer. What I can vouch for, however, is their selection of imported British goods. This is where my review gets more positive. There are various baking goods, cookies, and drinks. But the real gem is the vast selection of British chocolates. Anyone who knows chocolate will tell you that British chocolate, with its milk-base, is vastly superior to the sugar-based crap they sell here in the States. Since the recent Cadbury ban, finding some of our favorites isn't as easy as it once was. Thankfully, they keep an extensive selection of all of the good stuff - although I'm reluctant to reveal just what, for fear that everyone will go deplete their inventory.  If you like British food, it's definitely worth checking out. If you like English candy and your timing is right with their imported shipments, you've stumbled upon a chocolate lover's gold mine!  Recommended for the British goods and I suppose at least trying out the food.
Overpriced but really good fish! I had the cod sandwich. Service was so so. I will be back at some point in the future when I get a craving but it's too expensive but what you get to come regularly.

Great mini grocery for imported English canned and jarred goods, but the food is bland, tasteless MEH!  --great selection of beers on tap --happy hour drink specials until 7pm --fun little mini grocery for your english junk food favorites and jarred Hayward and Coleman's products. --no-frills, drop-ceiling triple-wide strip-mall joint. No apologies, just solid English food...  But the food is BLAND. Tasteless, flavorless, boring MEH. There is a gigantic salt shaker nearby and you're going to need it!!  ## shepherd's pie arrives in black rectangular plastic bin, straight from the microwave. Sent straight back. Come on!  Is English food supposed to be so uninteresting? Give me a seasoned and panko-dusted piece of any fish, any day of the week over this meh crap.  What a shame.

I myself don't like the food much but that's because I'm not a British food kind of person.My boyfriend on the other hand loves the cod fish and chips.He lived in London and this place reminds him of the food he ate in London and he says it's good.Service is friendly.

Before I say anything, I want to give the proprietors of this business mad props on the name.   Although they don't make an offer that I can't refuse, the name alone is tempting enough to give the place a try even though fried fish isn't really my thing.  It's fish and chips.  Greasy, oily, fried fish and french fries.   If that's what you're looking for, then this is the place for you.  If you're looking for some sort of classy cuisine because it's british, then Codfather is the wrong joint for you.  My girlfriend and her parents are from across the pond, and they love this little strip mall fast-food spot.  They say its the closet fish and chips in the valley to England.  I've never been to Europe, so I wouldn't know.  They're also big fans of the minimart Codfather has set up by the register.  It has a bunch of foods imported from the UK that you can't find anywhere else.  Codfather has a nice little variety of fish to bread and fry.  There's also a decent menu of british meals and fast-food meats.  A good selection of imported beer also makes for a nice dining experience.  On the night we dined at Codfather, they were hosting some sort of poker tournament.  I didn't ask what the deal was, but it looked like a lot of fun.  And if you didn't know it was a british restaurant just based on the menu, there's plenty of flags and soccer (oh, sorry, I guess that's football in here) on the TV.

Companion and I had lunch at this restaurant. This was our second visit, with our first having been about a year ago.   We were promptly seated and offered drinks. Unfortunately, their selection of non-sugared drinks is rather sparse and I ended up having tea with no lemon. Fortunately, being a "British" restaurant they have an idea of what tea should taste like and no harm done.  Companion and I started of with a Scotch egg. It was cooked nicely, and served cut into quarters to make our sharing easier. The egg is served with what I surmised to be Coleman's English Mustard, which I really enjoyed. Most Scotch eggs served in the U.S. are made with regular seasoned pork sausage, which is highly seasoned compared to English sausage, however this sausage was perfectly seasoned in the true English tradition.  Next came the main dishes. Companion ordered the Steak and Kidney Pie and I ordered Bangers and Mash.  While the Steak and Kidney Pie was but a shadow of the real thing one would get in any pub (even at a roadside on the M5) the flavor was acceptable, however the kidney was nothing but mince. The pie was more like a Cornish Pasty than a true baked small pie. The pie came with no accompaniments whereas in the U.K. it usually comes with a side of mash and some mushy peas.  My Bangers and Mash arrived and was nicely plated. Unfortunately, that was the only good thing about the dish. The Bangers, while nicely cooked were loaded with salt. I thought that perhaps one of them had received some extra seasoning during the creation process, but alas, taking a bite from the second one revealed the same extreme amount of salt. The mash was acceptable, and was made from Yukon Gold potatoes, but the peas, which we were told were brought in from Boston were shriveled and lacking flavor. This plate was inedible. Companion, who the doctor had just prescribe a much higher amount of salt in her diet ate some of the Bangers to comply with her doctor's wishes. Speaking for myself, I finished three large glasses of Iced Tea and later stopped at a local McDonald's for a large soft drink.  The bathroom was nice and clean and it appeared that the restaurant was also clean. Tables were bussed regularly and wiped down.  2 stars for cleanliness and pleasant service.

Aaaaah The worst! Our stomachs are sick !!! Had the worst fish & chips ever!!! It was so Disgustingly Greasy!!! The vinegar was watered down or something and did nothing help it!!! It was all you eat but I couldn't eat much! I did not even want their fries!!  My husband got the calamari which was all batter!!! And beef and onion pie which was mostly pastry with very little meat inside!! We almost tried the whole menu ! No happy! The staff was so nice that we did not have the heart to complain to her!! Will not go back!
Great fish & chips (pollock the day I was there, changes daily), good prices, friendly staff, cool atmosphere. Will definitely go back, often.
Literally the best fish and chips you will ever eat! And that the fish is all organic is just the cherry on top! Also they have a good selection of English beers that you can get a flight of

Why are there two listings on Yelp for this place?  Ever since my trip to Europe last March 2008, I get a hankering for real beer-battered fish and chips now and then. This pairing is not complete in my mind until you serve it with a steaming hot side of mushy peas. As it would turn out, mushy peas are hard to come by here in the desert, but I am not one to give up so easily. (Rosie's, by the way, doesn't have this buttery little delicacy, reminiscent of Linda Blair on a particularly possessed and angry day.) To my sheer delight, The Codfather did not disappoint! Though just a bit mushier than I remember them being across the ocean, these mushy peas are seasoned well and have a nice buttery flavor.  There are a variety of fish on the menu for your liking. I had the 4 oz. portion of the traditional cod and found it to be more than enough, good flavor and good texture. It sat atop a modest portion of soggy chips in a plastic basket lined with wax paper and was served with a small serving of tartar sauce in a clear plastic bucket with a lid (cocktail sauce was an option too). My husband had the 7 oz. portion of sea bass served on a plate and I did not like it as much - it was a bit too soggy throughout. After tasting my cod, he said he wished he had ordered the same instead.  SAVING GRACES: Fun mementos throughout! The Union Flag, a photo of the Queen, Charles and Diana, a double decker bus, a sign for Picadilly Circus...The menu! Everything British, from Scottish Eggs to Cornish Pasties, Even the dessert is fried, so go elsewhere if you're recovering from your bypass surgery.  GRIPES: Greasy fish & chips difficult to eat in the small plastic basket - a plate would have been helpful. Need patience to squeeze out enough ketchup from the little packets on the tables. Being environmentally minded and too hungry to waste time tearing open 10 little ketchups, a refillable squeeze bottle would have been great. They use them for the hot sauce instead...a little misleading. Stingy serving of tartar sauce served with all portion sizes of fish. Extra sauces will cost you .25 cents each. More like a diner and less like a pub.  Imagine! A little taste of nostalgia only 5 minutes from my house. And at under $10, my husband is thrilled at the money we're saving now that I don't have to buy an international plane ticket in this economy.  If it's mushy peas you're looking for, you've come to the right place! If  you can do without, hit Rosie McCaffrey's for the best fish and chips in town with the ambience of an international pub.
Excellent fish and chips. The plus is that they have a full bar so you can have a beer or whatever with your meal. TV in the bar also. Very authentic food. A must try if you like fish and chips.

Always great service when I come here. Servers are friendly and on top of their game and are consistent no matter what time of day. Food is always delicious, too. Ample parking and wonderful atmosphere overall.

The cod is delicious! The cole slaw tastes homemade, very good! Bangers (sausages) and Mash (mashed potatoes and gravy) are very tasty! Haven't had everything on the menu,  but we're working on it!  The prices are reasonable.  Nice pub with a real nice wait staff!

Homey atmosphere, very good selection of beers with European selections. Okay customer service but high turnover but terrible food hygiene. Worst yet, denial by the owner that it couldn't possibly be theirs even when you see a young gentleman in the back with long hair (in his defense he was wearing a hairnet but the hair was in the batter). Absolutely zero address to the hair that was fried in with the fish to us. They did ask if I wanted another serving as I declined with a grimace but they still had the audacity to charge me full price. After I told them "c'mon at least take off the fish, the owners disputed amongst themselves again of what to do, really loud so I can hear them as they look at me. Then the wife comes up to the register rings up a new check and leaves, again not a word, no apology. The new guy that's only been there two weeks tells me the new amount is 20% off excitedly yet NO APOLOGY! This place cannot afford to compensate fish much worse any apologies whatever happened to good ole customer service?   PS. My husband and I initially believed their denial "it's not us we don't have long hair" till the long hair dude came out he said he didn't have a hairnets at all at that time!
Loved it. It's a mom-and-pop sort of place, but the fish and chips were delicious, and the prices were very reasonable. Had the cod and a banana fritter for dessert. Great stuff.
Delicious!! Service was friendly and food was great. I had cod and chips! Superb!

Wow!! Delicious. We got the mahi mahi fish & chips & can I just say wow! Super natural sweet fish taste where you could eat it without anything added. The potato crisps are delicious & so are there are chips!

Why doesn't this place have a higher rating?? The fish and chips here are so delicious. This is how fish and chips is supposed to taste like. This place delivers consistently on quality and flavor. Sure, it's probably not great for you but who the eff cares when it tastes this good. I am from Seattle originally and this is the only place in the valley that satisfies that greasy delicious fish craving I get. Don't forget to try their other english food (the bangers and mash are also bomb) and look through some of their english food and treats that you can buy for home. Keep it up!

I ordered cod fish and chips to go and a scotch egg. I ate it pretty quickly from curbside though. Fries and egg were soggy and the fish breading was too. Cod was nice quality though, the egg was alright but I had never had such a thing before. Cute pub and what looks like a nice selection of brews.

Stopped in Saturday around 3, it wasn't busy at that time of day.  My husband and I both had fish & chip meal and ordered extra sides so we could try the slaw too.  The fish itself was good but the batter was a bit soggy and so there was a lot of grease between it and the fish.  It wasn't cooked quite long enough to get crispy but it was thoroughly cooked.  Slaw was good but watery, fries weren't salted.   Our waitress said it was her second day whenever we asked her menu questions, and wasn't very talkative or overly friendly.  I will probably try it again sometime.  $34 for two meals, two sides of slaw, and coke and one beer so reasonable prices.
Has always been fabulous and worthy for expat evaluations.. am hoping that tonight is not a norm snd that they get back to great fish n chips soon.  Service as always-exceptional.

Truly authentic English fish and chips - I was back in England two weeks ago, had Fish N Chips three times and The Codfather was better than two of them...  I LOVE the English breakfast they do at the weekend (but don't open until 10:00) as well as the homemade pies, pasties and sausage rolls... they also have an English store section in there for various English goodies and frozen food as well as a great bar section with a wide range of English / European beers both draft and bottled. Well worth a visit!

Being a Brit I know these are the real deal ,the haddock is my fave but everything I've tried there is good. Plenty of Brit foods well stocked bar and nice little Brit goodies shop inside. Saturdays is all you can eat cod & chips.

Newly decorated, awesome beer and cider line up and Fish and Chips. How can you go wrong?  This is by far some of the best fish and chips I have had in the valley, hands down. I am exposed to every fish fry and pizza joint in the valley as my husband is working through them all and I really like The CodFather.  I have tried the Fish and Chips and the onion rings here. I was not disappointed, the tarter sauce is tangy, the fish is hot and fresh. The batter is awesome. Have a pint of strongbow cider. Do it. It goes great with the meal.  I also think its really cool that they have a little store with all sorts of items from across the pond. Stuff you really wouldn't be exposed to here in America. I dig it.  Protip: They are closed on Mondays.
Everything was greasy and saturated with oil. They also charge $2 extra if you don't want your fish fried!!

Cozy place with amazing food . Love the cod with mashed potatoes and gravy . They are to die for . We also had the rice and chicken curry and to our pleasant surprise they were delicious . We are going to be there every week !
Great value.  Excellent cod.  Pretty good mahimahi.

Wow, I came on here to send a link about this place to a friend and was surprised to see so many neg reviews.  My family moved over here from Yorkshire, in the UK, when I was a kid and has been on the look out for good fish and chips ever since!  The Codfather is the first place in 25 years that passed muster.  My folks drive miles all the way from the East Valley to go to this place and I drive up from central Phoenix to join them.  Yorkshire could be considered the epicenter of the fish and chip addicted Brit and even gets riffed on for it.    The couple that own this place imported their fryer equipment and alot of their ingredients from the UK - they even have haddock on the menu which you NEVER see anywhere out here (haddock is a flaky north atlantic white fish that is superior to cod - do not get cod if you can have haddock instead).  As I read the neg reviews I realize most of them appear to be reviewing the type of food vs. the restaurant. Its like giving a bad review to an Indian restaurant if you don't like Indian food - not cool.  Yes, its a hole in the wall and the owner is a no-nonsense Londoner, and yes, NEWSFLASH: fried food is greasy!  But these are the best authentic British fish and chips you will get.  If you don't like that type of food, don't slam a (small, hard working, family run) restaurant thats doing a really good job at it.  Some educational tidbits for the uninitiated:  1.They serve chips not fries - chips are soft not crisp 2. Ask for/try HP sauce with it - thats what many Brits prefer over ketchup 3. Don't get it to go if you can avoid it- the heat of the food in the container continues to steam the food and its not as good (or the batter as crisp) when you get it home 4. In the Northern UK you primarily get haddock, in the south its mostly cod, which is greasier - try haddock if you've never had it. 5. The reason vinegar is typically applied to fish and chips is to cut the grease - give it a whirl

My friend drove 30 miles one way to here she had fish & chips but she picked up sausage rolls chocolate for me as I am org from Scotland the chocolate was so stale she tried to get my money back which was 25.00 for the candy we sent them photos they gave her a hard time wanted the chocolate back she then drove 60 miles round trip I would not buy anything here there customer service is so bad

The Codfather is my new neighborhood spot. I love this little place, and for many good reasons.  I'm huge on service, and am not afraid to indulge in food and beverage alone and therefore, I usually elect to sit at the bar most places. The Codfather is no exception.   Meet Jordan. He is always quick to greet me with a smile, and after my first visit he has remembered my drink order each time. Never an empty drink, and not just mine. This guy knows what he's doing behind his small, but always busy bar. Not long after my first sip, I'm greeted by Mark. Mark, owns the joint. You can usually find him chatting with, and greeting guests near the bar.   Great fish and chips. The jalapeno poppers are my favorite to snack on here, made in house, huge and cheesy! Killer happy hour with includes $2 domestic bottles and $1 off pints, which is a nice selection to choose from.   Great atmosphere, awesome service, good food, and nice price points. Not to mention a pretty cool eclectic group of regular guests. Overall, just a good spot. Keep it up Mark and Jordon!

Yes I expected better because I've eaten here before.I actually predicted the outcome of the product based on the actions that occurred in the minutes that followed . A dark- haired lad, handsome with a chiseled face damn near broke his neck getting to the counter. He shoved a menu into my hands not saying a word. It made me feel awkward, like hurry up, order, and get out is how I took the vibe. For sure the end justified the means because the fish was soggy,the coating did not envelope the fish and a shake of salt would have been not just nice but required.I don't wish to hurt the young man's feelings but ,"homeboy needs to put some love into his cooking" I know I fry fish on a regular basis and the reason the coating didn't stay on is because of improper cooking oil temperature or varying the temperature of the cooking oil. This mistake is widely experienced by many amateur or part time cooks, but just the same I don't appreciate this blunder at 12.95 a plate. Normally when using my Visa after signing the restaurant's copy of the receipt the clerk offers me what is already mine, my copy of the receipt. Instead he threw mine in the circular file, was he making a prediction or did he know something I did not ? It helps to have a receipt when you have a complaint, does it not ? He didn't even ask me if I wanted the copy he just threw it away promptly. Hmmmm?  In addition I would add that the Codfather is a fish and chips restaurant, that's the specialty. Therefore chips should be a part of every regular order, instead you must choose between slaw, chips, etc. If the powers that be read my review the most important point I must stress to you all is put a competent cook behind that fryer, you can produce a good product you have for me in the past. Don't be freakin stingy with the chips, give them generously with every order then charge for other items on the side. Not trying to tell you how to run your business but we are the public , we are not stupid , we shop and we know how inexpensive potatoes are, you all "feel me". Your going to generate more revenue by word of mouth from people bragging on your quality and large helpings then omitting what you know we as customers are entitled to, for the purpose of saving money(overhead). This visit I did not get what I expected and I spent close to 60.00 at your establishment. I BELIEVE you need to make an adjustment you may not think so, in any case, to solve any differences, simply ask yourselves do you want my business or do you not want my business. Yelp submits this review to your restaurant and you have an opportunity to let me know where you stand on this issue, if and when you respond, but I'm not holding my breath.

we have been driving by this place for years but just stopped in for the first time.  Wow we really should have come sooner.  This place is great.  everything we ordered exceeded my expectations.  The menu is much bigger then I expected too.  Come here you will like it.

Great fish! It would be better if the chips were not fries but with it so hard to find a place that does good haddock and cod, I can't complain. Worth the drive from south Phoenix, a small taste of home in the middle of the desert. They even have a Brit shop too!
One of the few places to get British style food in Phoenix. But don't count on it being that great.
Really liked it. Good place to eat. English style food. Bangers and mash were really good and the the onion rings are really good too!

They no longer carry Guinness Draught. It has been replaced with Murphy's Irish Stout ($3/pint by the way). If ordering on the restaurant side, the cashiers are always underage, so they can never advise you on specialty beers available. Not a huge deal - but if you are stopping in for a pint, it's probably easier to sit on the bar side.   I also wish this place offered table service rather than ordering at the counter. Again, another reason to sit at the bar, I suppose.  Fish n chips still good!

The crab bites appetizer is just the best!  Real king crab.  Some of the best draft beers too. And oh, fish and chips that are the best around and reasonable.  Nice friendly atmosphere.  We head there first when family come in from the east coast.  Their favorite too.

I came here with my wife and daughter for a late lunch on the 6th.   We have been itching to get some good fish and chips and this place fit the bill. I had been here before ages ago and remembered it as being very good. Luckily, my memory was good. This place was awesome!  My wife ordered the small fish and chips and I had the large, although I was tempted by the all you can eat deal they had at the time. Our daughter had chicken strips off the kids menu.  What we learned was that the small fish and chips is not enough! The food leaves you wanting more. The cod was well prepared and the batter was delicious. The fries were even good!  The chicken also looked very good. I didn't try any but my wife ate a piece the next day when we were snacking on leftovers. She said it was still incredibly delicious and would love to try it fresh next time.  Service was very good as well and the restrooms were the cleanest I've seen.   We can't wait to return.
We stopped because we loved the name ...really surprisingly good food and great service from Brianna we will definitely be going back

I have been dining at this restaurant for the last 3 years and keep going back.  Mark and Ruth are the owners and from England. 90% of their menu is homemade and authentic. They are personally involved in the day-to-day operations and work hard to take care of everyone.  I enjoy their hospitality and the way they try to engage with everyone and receive feedback to keep improving their restaurant.   I love and recommend their pies, my favorite being Steak and Kidney and Cheese and Onion. The pastry and filling is to die for. They have awesome Fish and Chips with the lightest and tastiest batter ever. There fries are homemade, but I would recommend you ask for them to be freshly cooked so you can appreciate the true flavor and taste, which really can be appreciated if you put salt and vinegar on them : ) They do specials all the time which is great so you can eat great homemade food from England. There is English breakfast on weekends and they just started serving Saveloy Sausage, which was so tasty.  Try their garlic onion rings and sauce as well, they are addictive.  They have a full bar with English beers and have a happy hour and a drink card to get a free drink after 9 paid (I think).  The dcor is basic but does have English influence.  They have a gift shop corner where you can buy English supplies i.e. HP sauce, P.G. Tips, Walker crisps and lots of sweets.  There is a bit of staff turnover but Asia (Manager) has been there since they opened and is a sweetheart.  It really has become my local and I enjoy my time there every time I go.

I really want to give more than three stars, because my family loves this place.  However, the food is so greasy that I got ill once.  Great British beer selection and I love the football on the telly.  Owners are very friendly.  Even took me behind the bar to show the Guinness stout dispensing apparatus.    Not suggesting the food wasn't fresh and good.  It was.  And I have eaten here four or five times so it can be only so bad.  Just watch how much you consume if  a lot of grease doesn't sit well with you.  I believe they will broil your selection and that would resolve the problem.

I've always had mixed feeling about Codfather. It's an odd place. I've been coming here long before the quasi-pub went in, when it was more similar to a mom & pop version of Long John Silvers. Off the top of my head the absolute #1 thing to like Codfather is that they are NOT a me-too chain like Silvers.  Codfather never impressed me enough to rank them high on anything ... quality, price, atmosphere or service. Now after a couple of years I chose to return on one Friday night and despite the weirdly arranged "new" bar and dining area they still fail to wow me.  We ordered fish & chips to go. If you like your fish and fries mega-greasy (and some people love it that way) this is your nirvana. I wanted to tell my auto mechanic about this place as a major source of axle grease.  I grew up where Friday fish fries were a religion, always something dad would bring home on Fridays from some dingy little bar (he just stopped in just to get the food, honest) because in that part of the world no bar could exist unless they offered immense dirt-cheap all-you-can-eat and fantastically good fish fries to lure in the blue collar workers on payday. As a youth and traveling many places since then I know good fried fish.  I tried to verify the following but can't because Codfather's website menu isn't anything like the one in the restaurant, but (and I may have read it wrong) I thought I was ordering a FISH DINNER, you know with coleslaw and maybe another side but what is printed on my receipt is two orders of two cod fish at $10.20 each (just the fish, nothing else) and two orders of small chips at $2.75 each.  That's not what I expected.  I don't have much of a problem with each piece of fish costing about five bucks each, they were large pieces but $2.75 for soggy, undercooked, greasy fries is outrageous.  It's like they are purposely trying to piss their customers off.  The little service we had was okay. As mentioned above the ambience was weird, and at the height of dinner hour on a Friday night the place was half empty.  That's not a good sign.  The best I can muster for Codfather is that I still have mixed feeling about them but they certainly don't earn more than an average 3-stars.

As an Englishman who lives part time in the Valley, I was very impressed with the freshness and quality of the food. I had the large cod and chips with a side of curry sauce (Recommended) The batter was tender and crunchy and not too greasy and showed the chef had taken some care in the preparation. I visited with my wife and kids and they all commented on the food quality and cleaned there plates and commented it was like our chippy we used to use!  My only disappointment is that I have lived in Phoenix for the last 9 months and it has taken me this long to discover this place. I travel back to the UK every 6 weeks for work and it's nice I can find some food that reminds me of home when I come back.

I came here a while back with some friends to watch a game and even though it was decently filled w customers you could have sworn that they only had one server working. It took me an hour to get my food which was the wrong order. By the time I got my food my stomach was eating itself and I didn't have the energy to tell them it was wrong. Good food but I wish they hired more staff.

Way more greasy and less flavor than Long John Silver... $50 for 2 large orders of Cod and a kids meal. The fries are so greasy they are like eating mashed potatoes! We sat for 20min and received no drinks, and the kids meal that is supposed to come with a drink we had to remind the staff. Will not be coming back!! Greasy! Bland!! Over Priced!!!

I am really stuck in the middle here with Codfathers.  Part of me loves this place.  They have football on the telly, marmite, and tons of good beers.  The other part of me hates it because of the greasy food and the STRANGE clam chowder.  I just don't know what to do.  I order the mahi and chips.  The fries were really boring and cold.  The fish was decent but really wasn't cooked all the way through.  I also ordered a bowl of clam chowder.  I was expecting something like Ivars and got some runny cioppino-like stew.  It was really bad until I salted the hell out of it.  Then, it got strangely addictive and I couldn't stop eating it.    Really weird.  I'd like to come back here but I don't think it's going to happen.  I'm sure my wife hated it.

Been here several times. Love the fish, tonight there was a little drama. Since when do you put bacon in a "British" authentic clam chowder.  My vegetarian friend asked to have a new dish which they did. But they would not comp it from his menu because it was listed in the menu. However it was not on the menu board where it was listed as a special. All they did was 10% off. My friend even asked if it has any meat base.

Our experience while ordering take out at The Codfather was very nice!  We had very good customer service.  Although our food did take awhile, we didn't mind because it was made fresh and was very tasty.  I recommend the Cod and Chips...with vinegar, salt, and lemon juice!  Very good!    The ambiance is balanced and this place has an amazing beer list...something that i'll definitely take advantage of the next time we pop in.    I enjoyed the little "British" shop near the register and while looking around the staff told us that if we didn't see what we wanted we could place an order and they would order it for us.  I thought that was very nice of her to do.  My boyfriend ended up placing an order for Jaffa Cakes, which aren't available in the USA.    Very cool place right near us and we'll be back!

Excellent way to travel to Europe without leaving the states!  I love the beer selection and the fish is superb. The tartar sauce is definitely homemade ( I know because I asked) and the atmosphere is always friendly.  My UK friends love the food and now I know why.  Bangers and Mash? Squishy Peas? Mmmm. Sign me up.

The best fish and chips I've had so far! The fish is perfectly flaky, and the batter fried to a nice golden crisp. There's even a little store in the back where you can buy various imported English goods. Every time I step into Codfather's I feel as if I've been transported to England!

Decent fish and chips that tasted much better once I dipped them in the tartar sauce.  This is where the real British and New Zealand people go so if you want a genuine fish and chips type experience this probably the place to go.  They also have a little mini grocery aisle with overseas stuff like Veggiemite and stuff.  I'm not a fan of the decor here- it looks like a fast food place inside.  Would be cool if they had more of an old time English/Irish pub thing going on.  Maybe for the Codfather Too.
As good as it gets. If you want REAL fish and chips this is the only place in the Valley that will get the job done. It was like being back in England ... First Class Sir!

Again, I'm a sucker for a cute name. And thank God that this one paid off with also having amazing food. We stumbled upon this place by accident, but I seeing it on the side of the road as we are driving past. Like I said I could not pass up on a name like this. Staff was relatively friendly but kind of hands off. Batter on the fish could not have been crispier and later and did not leave a greasy feel around your mouth. My boyfriend basically inhaled his meal to where he got a second one to go that's kind of our true test of The place is worth returning

My husband is British and was craving fish n' chips.  There are English/Irish fish n' chips (battered)  and American (breaded) fish n' chips.  Codfathers has battered, and my husband was SO happy.    The venue is kinda funky in a strip mall with the foam tiled ceiling like a doctor's/ business office, and just 'conference or cafeteria style' chairs,  but the service was fine.  We just really wanted to like it.   There is a bar area to the side which we will likely dine in the next time to avoid families with babies etc.   There was no dripping grease others have spoke of.  Bland?  Um, it is ENGLISH/ UK food- and is expected to be doused with vinegar and salt.  White fish and batter is not by itself a super flavorful meal.  It's the texture you are going for and then the salt and vinegar on top adds the flavor.    If you want American/breaded fish- go elsewhere.  This is the real deal for people who like European Fish n' chips.    I had the mushroom/chicken pie which was actually more of a pastie.  I expected a dish with a pastry top (shepard's pie edition-ish)  and instead got a 'hot pocket' style pastie.  It was tasty, but too much pastry and not enough filling for me.  George and Dragon's is better and more to my liking as it's in a dish with the pastry only on top.     Overall, a positive experience.  My husband so often complains about fish 'n chips he orders being done in 'old oil' or 'over done' or 'under done'... tonight he just kept saying, "This is SO GOOD".  :)  We will go back.
Best fish in town, reminds me of the old pubs back east. Ice cold beer with great service. Good location for the older crowd very, peaceful setting and very quaint.
Great fish & chips... Very very pricey for what u get!  Unless you go on friday... but the Halibut is crazy expensive... One piece for 11 bucks... ??? Yeah....

My first trip I would've given it a 3. The fish and chips were good but the batter kept falling off. But we went two more times and each time it was better.  There are plenty of types of fish to have. The drinks were fair and tasty. And the atmosphere is nice. A few more trips and I may change my review to a 5. I'm not sure if the place is just getting that much better. Or if our first visit was a bit of an off day.

English is ironically an inadequate language to describe how wonderful this British pub is. I have eaten almost everything this chippie offers and it has always been great. The fish is outstandingly fresh, crispy, and perfectly cooked. Even the Steak and Kidney Pie, though humble, should not be missed.  Apparently there is some kind of "football" tournament going on now that has people excited and they all rather fancy watching it here. If kicking back a cold one while watching men kick a ball sounds like fun, then this is definitely your place.  Also, don't forget to visit their "expat shop" as I like to call it -- a section devoted to all of the tasty treats from across the pond.  I never knew the joy of a dolly mix until I found all of their sweets.

We go here once every few months.  The beer is great and they have a good selection.  The decor seems to struggle to find itself, but if the food is really good, who cares what it looks like.  They have added table service, which was not so great, but the beer was good, so......  Always get the cod fish and chips.  It all seems to cost more than it should, but I don't mind if I am supporting a local business.  The only thing I will remember is to face away from the kitchen space, because you can see everything they are doing in there, it's a bit unnerving and I don't care for having to ask for a key to the restroom.

Enjoyable experience on the pub side with a few pints of Fuller's London Pride.  Several British ales to choose from, and plenty of friendly smiles from the staff.  Many patrons from other countries here, and I found myself in the minority as far as accents go - to my ears at least.  May try food on next visit.  Unlike so many places these days, the pub here has some character and it is ideal for making it one's regular spot for a pint.
Great service and great food. Love the chicken curry.  A bot slow on take out but worth the wait!
The service was very good and clean place the cod was delicious not over done or grazing which is good I would definitely go back again

I went here with my boyfriend for lunch on a weekday on a whim after driving by. When we walked in the place was totally empty and we almost turned around but decided to try it. Service was ok, but pretty slow considering we were the only people in the place for over half of our stay. We both ordered fish and chips and were very disappointed. The fish was extremely greasy and the chips tasted raw. Maybe it would have been passable if it was a 3 dollar meal, but it was very expensive.  The entire experience was very awkward as well considering the place was empty for lunch on a weekday. On top of that, the owners (I think?) of the place came out about halfway through our lunch and started discussing business between themselves at one of the dining tables. Is there no better place for that?

Food was a 4 Decor was a 3 Music on Tuesday 4.5  Hey, I stopped by this authentic British Fish N Chips joint last night and was surprised that I could not find a spot near the restaurant  entrance to park at the parking lot was full and this was a small strip center on Bell road with retail and service stores that were all closed. The place was relatively full for a Tuesday night at 7PM...more on that.  Since I felt like having authentic "Fish and Chips" the very nice lady behind the counter says "What kind of fish"? They have traditional Cod and Halibut and Salmon and Corvina. Plus Shrimp and Scallops and a lot more.Well in as much as I have been trying to minimize the fried foods in my life, I felt that I was down a Quart of Oil....so what the heck. Hey I just ran the 1/2 marathon last week, so go for it.   Had a piece of cod and the scallops as well and an order of onion rings. I must say, I was impressed with the fish and scallops. Very crispy cod and a nice portion as well. I had 10 scallops ($6.00) which are scallops and nothing else but for $6.00. Pretty good.  Was not impressed with the miniscule serving of tartar sauce and it's $.25 extra per serving (about a tablespoon). Well I must admit I like a little fish with my Tartar sauce. Don't get me wrong, I was impressed with the flavor of the food. I guess I just had too much oil. Maybe that's why I did not like the onion rings as much. They were good but by now, I reached my limit of oil.Again, fish is expensive and these portions were very nice.  Here's the biggest surprise and would have given The Codfather another 1/2 star if Yelp allowed half stars which I guess they don't. It's open mike Tuesday and there was a pretty decent band playing. 4 pieces; Banjo, bass, 2 guitars. After a few sets, a duet with a gal and guitar and a guy playing a mandolin were next. Pretty good, gave the place a nice buzz, people were listening and it was an added bonus to my Tuesday meal.   Finally....Thursday night these Brits open it up to an Irish Band (Raic) and I'm going to go...for some food and music. A very nice surprise in N. Phoenix. They might get to 4 stars soon.   all the best

We visited this place when it first opened. We love fish and we're expecting a fabulous meal. All we smelled was grease when we walked in, and everything was greasy. So disappointed. We waited five years, noticed it was still open, must be good, so we went back. We had the same exact experience. I don't know why people continue to go here to eat. It's a shame because we could really use a good fish house in town.

I'm really disappointed that I have to write such a poor review for this place.  I'm not a big fan of fish, but I love it when it's all fried up and served with fries, so I wasn't worried about coming here.  When we walked in, I was a little confused at the setup, but it kind of grew on me.  It was very clearly a mom and pop style place, and I can definitely appreciate that.  The decor was pretty awful, but endearing at the same time.  I'm not sure why they were trying to cover up their wood tabletops with awful cheap tablecloths, but to each their own.  I also liked their impressive selection of British foodstuffs.  I wasn't too hungry, so I ordered the smaller portion of the cod and chips.  I really liked that they gave you the option to order a little less.  Maybe I was under the wrong impression that this should be a faster service restaurant because you order at a counter and pay at the counter, but our food took forever to get out to us.  The unfortunate things was seeing the cook put our fries onto our plate well before the fish made it.  That left us with lukewarm fries.  The fries, well, they sucked.  They weren't the crispy kind and they weren't salted at all.  The fish, I hate to say it, was disgusting.  It was over-battered and wasn't cooked long enough.  That left me with a nasty mess of mush all over my fish.  I had to scrape it all of to be edible.  Since this place calls themselves the Codfather, and I wasn't pleased with what is supposedly their specialty, I certainly don't see myself coming back.

Ugh, I hate having to write this review because I've followed this family run business for 14 years. I've been a loyal customer since they were in Fountain Hills and as a fellow ex-pat it was a lovely reminder of home. Wow has it deteriorated. We went for take out tonight, drove approx 15 miles round trip, ordered 2 points of lager as we waited and bought from the British store in the back. Total bill was $86 and for that we got some bags of chips/crisps, black pudding, hot cross buns ($39!!!!) and then 2 large(!) portions of haddock and chips... when we got them home the portion of chips was yet again TINY and way overcooked, if not re-cooked. Awful.  Dark brown. As for the staff... We have been coming here for years and every time they act like they don't know us, no welcome from Mark, the owner, who's always sitting and drinking at the bar and complaining how much he hates it and wants to be on a beach in Mexico. I've watched Jordan, their son, grow up and he used to be a friendly face behind the bar but I never see him anymore. Judy is simply awesome, works her ass off every time we see her and unending smiles and friendliness. A few weeks ago I saw the Bar Rescue team in there filming some initial shots and I thought, wow... it's just as bad as it can get. Maybe Jon Taffer can improve the standards, ambience, owners attitude, portions and prices but I'm not sure. We're sick of giving our loyalty and money to an ungrateful owner with no standards or consistency.

They don't care about customer satisfaction one bit! The atmosphere is very unsavory. Brightly lit, hot inside. The seats and tables look like lunchroom seating. There is a good old boys bar on the side, it's just weird. My whole family went there and the wait is longer than usual for food and the crab cakes are very gross. This was when I developed a problem with this place. I took a bite of the crab cake and it tasted like corn bread mixed with canned cat food, not a speck of crab to be found. I'm not sure how they can call it a crab cake and charge $8 for it. I told the waitress I wasn't happy with it and she was nice and said ok. We received the bill and  the uneaten crab cake charge was on it. I requested that the charge be removed and overheard her conversation with the owner. He said, "That's the way we make 'em and that's her problem if she doesn't like 'em!" They offered 10% off. I can't imagine anyone liking them as they were not even crab cakes which taste like they have crab in them. The cod was okay and I might have come back here if they had done the right thing. The management needs a lesson on customer service. We spent 50 dollars here and I left upset.
